Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Ruby0784
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so perfectly located in Chicago on a beautiful tree-lined street. Easy access to popular neighborhoods as well as nearby to trains and buses. The staff at this hotel was friendly and accomodating and very much cater to the needs of their guests. The hotel is rather business-centric, so it might not be the best option for a family on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Lori M
Reviews.Content: I jumped on a Living Social deal to stay at The Sutton Place Hotel. I surprised my husband for his birthday, and I am happy to say that this was the best birthday he's ever had! We checked in and met the most pleasant and helpful woman ever, Michelle G.. She overheard my husband telling the bell hop that it was his birthday so she offered a room upgrade for a very small charge. I have to admit, I had tears in my eyes when we walked into our Grande Suite. We have 6 kids and we don't get out very much, so this was a night that I will never forget. As a matter of fact, I will hold the memories fresh in my mind and look forward to our next visit. I will not "try" another hotel, there's no reason to. Everything is within walking distance. We walked to Oak Street Beach, walked to the 900 Shops, had an amazing dinner on Rush Street and had a breathtaking view of Lake Michigan. Every employee was so kind, everything was clean and we couldn't hear any other hotel guests the entire stay. I don't know quite how to say thank you.... Forget the other hotels, The Sutton Place is the place to go!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CJO71
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean, slightly dated and pretty average but hot! We faced the west and the afternoon sun baked our room. There was no way to open windows so it was quite warm(hot). However, the staff was very nice when we asked about it and they did send someone to take a look but we were informed there was nothing they could do. The hotel in itself is in a great location with tons of nice restaurant options nearby. The subway was also just a short walk away as well as all the great shopping Chicago has to offer. The only real disappointment was the Whiskey Bar and Grill. After a long day of shopping and touring around we looked forward to a nice drink back at our hotel but service was just so so and drinks and food were sub par. Overall with the reasonable room rate, courteous staff and great location we would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “recent trip”
Reviews.Author: thechack
Reviews.Content: people were fabulous, even the doorman and the service..however the property itself is getting "run down"....been staying there for years..now seeing its age....had to switch rooms twice because of heater issues, food was only mediocre (room service)..used to be great !

Reviews.Title: “Good but something missing”
Reviews.Author: LAKTEX
Reviews.Content: We (my daughter and I) arrived on Friday evening, she from Vancouver and me from London UK. It was the Friday of the snow storm so our journey had been slow. I had booked through Air Canada for a Deluxe Lakeview - two double beds but was shown to a standard room with one bed - that really disappoints me - the booking is clear - why do they not get it right first time? we got the right room eventually. We popped across the snowy road to Gibsons for a bite to eat and as many reviewers say, this is a great place for great steaks and there are many other eating establishments nearby. Next morning we could see our room properly and with the floor to ceiling windows on two sides (corner room) on the 18th floor the views were great - we do like views from our bedrooms wherever we are. Room was generally good - a little dated in places, the bathroom a good size and a nice separate glass shower cubicle with a good showerhead. Beds comfortable and a decent work desk - the TV was an old bulky CRT type and really ought to be replaced with a modern flat screen and similarly the dated CD player with an ipod connection. I do feel that internat connection shud be free - why can I go to Starbucks and spend a few dollars on a coffee and get free internet but spend hundreds on a room over four nights and have to pay for WiFi? The Whiskey Bar and Grill is OK but I would have thought an additional more sophisticated eatery appropriate for this establishment - perhaps the problem is all the alternatives nearby. At least the internet connection was free in the bar. Really not sure if I would stay here again - it was reasonable value but I had expected more - personally I do not think it compares with the Vancouver property.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mshoo
Reviews.Content: We booked this after staying at The Sutton Place in Vancouver - yet they are different management companies. We had an equally pleasant experience. You cannot beat this location - across the street from Gibson's Steak House and near several other famous restaurants. about a 10 minute walk from the miracle mile and close to so many things. The front desk was great and the bar downstairs is a fun spot. We loved our large corner room. If there was anything negative I would say the rooms are just a little dated but very clean and comfortable. This was a great value and we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the business traveler!”
Reviews.Author: ConstanTraveler77
Reviews.Content: This place is an a better than average hotel in an AWESOME location. The hotel staff is great. The accommodations are 4 star and I slept very well. Better than I normally do on the road. The neighborhood is great. Your just across the street from some great local restaurants and the shopping district is second to none (and I walk Rodeo Drive weekly). This is a wonderful and safe location.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to the New Year”
Reviews.Author: BeemerTraveler
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel prior to check-in time and was pleasantly greeted by the desk clerk (Jammar). I requested a room on a higher floor and was immediately accomodated. The room was large, well appointed and very quiet. The bathroom is large with a separate shower and ample hot water. The bed was extremely comfortable with nice linens. The location of this hotel is perfect if you want to be close to good restaurants and pubs. Across the street is the original pancake house which serves a great breakfast. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent! However, lacking the "X Factor"”
Reviews.Author: 4VICCI
Reviews.Content: For many years, while vacationing in Chicago, I passed by this hotel on my way to Gibson's, Hugo's, Dublin's and the Original Pancake House and I thought "this would be a great place to stay". The location couldn't be better on beautiful East Bellevue Place and Rush Ave next to the BEST of the best of restaurants, shops, and bars on Rush Avenue. Guest rooms are large with comfortable beds although the linens were ridiculously thin and the sheets (not fitted) kept coming undone which was frustrating. The bathroom was large with excellent bath amenities ("Gilchrist & Soames), 2 terry robes, a powerful shower and huge soaking tub which came in handy after a day of Christmas shopping. There was even a drawer where we could store our make up and toiletries. We tried the restaurant downstairs for breakfast (a deviation from our normal trip across the street to the Original Pancake House!) and I had Eggs Benedict which was good (not great) and reasonably priced. The SP has a lovely lounge downstairs called The Whiskey where you can sit, drink, (watch TV on one of the many large screens) or watch the people pass by the lounge from the large windows on Rush Avenue side. I think this Whiskey is a branch of the once famous LA-based "Whiskey-A-Go Go". Kind and efficient front desk lady, (forgot her name--sorry!) the only one there and always working, also helped us find the U Alabama Alumni bar ("The Houndstooth") where we watched the UA v Auburn game--a raucous party indeed! A big thanks to her for that!! My only reservations about this hotel: 1) there were way too many doormen and not enough front desk staff. Every time I came downstairs to inquire about something, either the desk was vacant, or the poor young lady working was swamped while the doormen mulled around with nothing to do. The same lady worked the entire time (4 days) we were there--I hope she gets paid appropriately! 2) I had previously informed the SP that we had a third person who was coming in the day AFTER we arrived. However the SP charged us an extra person charge [$40] for the first day although the person hadn't even arrived!!! When I complained about this nothing was done nor offered. 3) no ice machines--must call room service and 4) no coffee/coffee maker in rooms (although excellent coffee in lobby during morning hours). So, location perfect, bar excellent, happy and friendly doormen, good morning coffee in the lobby but obviously not Four Seasons or Ritz level. The employees were nice enough but the X Factor traditionally exhibited by 4-5 **** hotels was definitely missing. May stay there again IF the price is right and we get a view other than that of Barney's of New York-LOL!

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: Donna H
Reviews.Content: The rooms and bathrooms definitely need updating. The rooms and nice and big, the hotel is in a great location and the staff is nice. If the rooms were updated this would definitely be a 5 star hotel. I'll cross this one off my list for now.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lakeview room”
Reviews.Author: kjdpm
Reviews.Content: Booked a King lakeview room - it was beautiful with two walls of windows, one of which facing out toward the lake. The convenience to Rush street restaurants is great. The Original Pancake House is directly across the street, so no problem getting up, throwing on sweats and heading over at 7AM for breakfast. Also connected via the lobby is Whiskey bar that had great atmosphere on Saturday night. The Sutton Place staff was very helpful, The room was beautiful and large and again the convenience to shopping and dining is great. As compared to other hotels in the area for a busy pre-holiday weekend, this was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: dallas12345
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because one of our friends who does a lot of research recommended it. We were very pleased. It was in an upscale part of town with a variety of nearby dining options. Try the Al Manatti's down the street for deep dish pizza. The hotel offered an a credit for an extra charge that we read could be used for things like meals and drinks. Because " the computers were down," while we were in the bar, the waiter refused to charge drinks to the room. By being cooperative, I thought we would earn some flexibility from the front desk in spending it or just crediting the amount we paid for the credit. Not so. To avoid losing these funds, we had to plan another meal there, which did not sit right with me because there were other places we wanted to check out in the area. The Original Pancake House across the street is one that visitors to the area will like, too. So, I would just avoid spending the $20 to "get the $50."

Reviews.Title: “Great location - wonderful staff - nice rooms - great value!”
Reviews.Author: graygirlSTL
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I have stayed at the Sutton Place twice when visiting Chicago. The location is ideal - walking distance to several restaurants, bars, coffee shops, and the magnificent mile shopping. The hotel staff is impeccable - the rooms are nice and clean - we even got upgraded (promptly) to a corner room that had two walls of floor to ceiling windows when we had issues with our heater not turning off on our last visit. I have and will continue to recommend this hotel to people who are looking for a hotel in a good location that is also a good value (for Chicago).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: princesscel
Reviews.Content: We had read mixed reviews about this hotel and were a little scared upon arrival. We loved it! My husband and I took off for a few days and never regretted our stay at the Sutton Place. Clean room, nice bathrooms, great location and walking distance to Magnificent Mile. The one thing we did not like was there was only one outlet in the room and it was behind the curtain so we did not find it until the last day. The beds were extremely comfortable as well. Concierge was great, they gave us "priority seating" for Gino's east pizzeria we also got free breadsticks for using it. O'hare airport is about 20 minutes away with a taxi and will cost roughly $35. Original house of pancakes was right across the street but I recommend eating at Tempo Cafe two blocks down. Pancake house kicked us out for bringing in a star bucks cup. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Ryan M
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a weekend visit to Chicago with my girlfriend. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Sutton Place. The location is excellent and very near many restaurants, bars, shopping, etc. Our room was a very good size, was very clean, and well appointed. The only complaint we really had was there were no plugs next to the bedside tables so our cell phones (also double as alarm clocks) were on the other side of the room. The customer service was excellent and we had no issues checking in or out. Recommendations for food just outside the hotel: Gibsons, LuxBar, Whisky Bar, Pancake House, Lou Malnati's Pizza, Bistro Zinc, and Tavern on Rush were all excellent. We also highly recommend the comedy show Second City which is about a 20 minute walk from hotel or 5 minute cab ride. This hotel is about a $35 cab ride from O'hare airport. Easy walk to Magnificent Mile shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jsoxy
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms (king suites) through a special deal on the Jetsetter website, and stayed there November 2-6, 2011. The location is absolutely fantastic. It's right off of Rush Street and within easy walking distance of upper Michigan Avenue shopping. Our rooms were very well laid out with a living room/bar area, a bedroom area (awesome mattress) and a nice bath. The staff was terrific, and Marc the concierge gave us great advice on where to shop and where to bar hop. The elevators are lightning quick, which I like...or should I say I hate really slow elevators that make you wait a long time. My only complaint was that they never refilled our minibar, but I'm sure they would have if we had called downstairs. They also were very disorganized in storing our luggage for about an hour after checkout....but finally found all the bags in different areas after 15 minutes of searching. Overall, I would heartily recommend this hotel if you want to really drink in the lively and beautiful city of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Get Away”
Reviews.Author: Wingers2001
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of a weekend stay at The Sutton Place in the beginning of October 2011 this was a company outing and we were in a party of 37 people. On arrival we were pleasantly greeted and promptly given our room keyâ€™s. We were put on the 22 â€œPHâ€� floor in 2206 and the room was more than could be expected, it was spacious with an elegant bathroom which had a tub and a separate shower. The room also came with a balcony which we used in the afternoon to relax, although it was a little breezy, just Chicago living up to itâ€™s name â€œthe windy cityâ€�. The location was great and we took advantage of Mike Ditkas Restaurant on Friday Night and Gibsons Steak House on Saturday, both fantastic food. Breakfast was included with our stay and ther was no shortage of food to get you going for the day. We could walk to most attractions and when we return to Chicago we would not hesitate to book in The Sutton Place again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pammyb72
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the heart of Chicago and provides excellent customer service. I visited with my husband and 3 year old daughter and we stayed in a junior executive suite on the 20th floor. The views were amazing and the room was fantastic, very spacious and clean. Staff were were friendly and helpful, nothing was a problem. We didn't eat in the hotel as there are so many lovely places right on the doorstep. Must go to Frogs Bar, Luxbar, Pancake House and the Tavern, all of which are very child friendly and reasonably priced. you can walk to most places from the hotel although taxi's and trains are very close and cheap. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay then when we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Purrfect Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: gnatroam
Reviews.Content: So nice to stay at a boutique hotel amidst the many big name, no character competitors. The staff were soo friendly and for some unknown reason they upgraded us to a penthouse suite, wow! If you are so lucky, you will enjoy a two-story suite with a spiral staircase leading to the bedroom with ensuite bath (tub separate from tiled, glass-encased shower, lovely). Two separate balconies, one from the room upstairs overlooking the lake and another full-sized patio from the living room overlooking the city. The location was great too, on river north just outside the hustle bustle of the loop area but also central to restaurants and shopping. I wish I could live here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: deb1981
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a Great Chicago sojourn. Stayed at the Sutton place which is definitely in a happening area. Lots of restaurants and three blocks from the Mag Mile. Rooms were spacious. Only complaint was that it was to have a Continental breakfast included, which it did but a very MODEST one. Definitely do not stay there for the free breakfast. Luckily for us the Original Pancake House was just across the street. YEA!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: bugdok
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was disappointing. To start, our bath robe (only one in the room) was dirty with makeup from a previous guest. Then I tried to run the bath tub and the water coming out of the faucet essentially looked like sewer water. For the price tag, there are so many other hotels in this area that I will definitely avoid staying in this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonUna
Reviews.Content: This is our second time at the Sutton Place, having previously stayed two years ago for the Chicago Marathon. This time we were over for the marathon again and we found that the hotel was even better then we remembered, with some aspects improving 100%. For example we ordered breakfast, very early for Marathon morning. The breakfast arrived prompt. It was hot, fresh and really good and delivered to our room with a smile. We also had a mix up with the room telephone, where on our final invoice the hotel had listed some calls that we did not make. The front staff could not have been more helpful and removed the calls without any fuss or problem. ;We also had a problem with our return flight to the UK and had to try and get in touch with Virgin Atlantic. Again the staff at the front desk could not have been more helpul, trying to ring Virgin, even though she was busy dealing with guests. The hotel supplies complementary coffee and tea every morning in the lobby, a lovely touch. The rooms were clean and bright. The bathroom spacious with a lovely strong shower and plenty of hot water and towels. The rooms were cleaned to a high standard. I do not think you can find a better location than this hotel. We have explored Chicago from morning till night on foot and the location of The Sutton Place, with the wiskey bar beside it where you can sit and watch all the comings and goings in this busy, tree lined corner of Chicago, in my opinion can not be matched. You are opposite three outstanding restaurants, Gibsons, Hugo's and Mortons. Not to mention the popular Carmines and Tavern on Rush. You are a five minute walk from the lake and from Mitchigan Avenue. If I come to Chicago again I will only look to stay at one hotel, The Sutton Place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at great location!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelBang
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for two nights. Really nice room on the 19th floor. Nice bathroom with good preasure in the shower. Clean and nice. The hotel staff was really friendly and did a lot to make my stay worth remembering. I was let in to their fitness room to freshen up before my 10pm flight, after having explored Chicago all afternoon. The Whiskey Room at the hotel is a cool place. Good service and good looking staff :) I can recommend the Dublin Bar & Grill across the street. One of the best burgers I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: MomsterToronto
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect for a visit to Chicago. The Sutton Place is located at the north end of the Magnificient Mile shopping. Away from the tourist spots in a lovely neighbourhood but just around the corner from pubs, restaurants, boutique shopping and a short walk to the lake. The staff were very friendly and even though we booked through expedia to get a great deal on the hotel we were treated like a somebody and even received a room upgrade to a lake view. The pancake house right across the street was a perfect start each day. Don't miss Jilly's for entertainment and a drink just around the corner each evening.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in 10 years of trips to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: lucyAkron
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I have been visiting Chicago for 10 years. Every year we try a new hotel. This year we stayed at The Sutton Place and all agreed it was the best location ever! We had 2 rooms that were Lake View. The rooms had very large windows and we could actually lay on our very comfortable beds and see the sailboats on Lake Michigan. It is on the corner of Rush street, so all we had to do was walk a few minutes and have restaurants at our finger tips. All of which were fantastic. We were able to block off the hallway with a door so that we could walk back and forth between our two rooms. It was the most perfect spot, close to Magnificent Mile and just about anything you could want. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: bluegene1
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Labor Day weekend. A wonderful time. The room was beautiful, modern, with a great view of the city. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful room, very accommodating hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine1111_11
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here in July to celebrate her 60th. I mentioned this to the staff and the hotel left a plate of chocolate covered strawberries for her when we returned from shopping. They also allowed us to leave our car a few hours extra on each end of our stay. They so friendly and accommodating, I couldn't believe it. You just don't see this very often - especially in a big city. Our room was spotless and beautiful. It was just what I wanted and it was reasonably priced. I would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: bears013
Reviews.Content: this hotel was nice it was nothing fancy, it was very clean the staff was very friendly , alot of great restaurants and bars nice and close

Reviews.Title: “Cubs Game Annual Weekend”
Reviews.Author: 76Bulakowski
Reviews.Content: every year we travel to chicago to go to cubs game and the sutton place is the best in location and service. good location great staff, love to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “vacation in chicago”
Reviews.Author: lisa r
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable. The beds were great. I travel to Chicago all the time and have stayed in most of the 4 + star hotels. I will say that this hotel was the most friendly and professional hotel I stayed at. From Gary the parking attendant to the front desk managers. The cleaning crew was great along with the friendly bartenders at the Whiskey bar. Thanks and would return again. Lisa

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: ladyofshalott306
Reviews.Content: We got this place for a good rate through Hotwire. The hotel was right off Rush street and surrounded by a bunch of restaurants--which was very nice! Just a couple blocks south of the hotel was all the shopping on Michigan Ave. The hotel lobby was quite small, almost like a botique style hotel. We arrived around 11:30am Saturday morning over the Labour Day weekend and they were able to check us in early to our room--which was great!! The room was nice, the bathroom was big. I enjoyed the deep soak tub and separate shower. To me this hotel did not feel like a four star hotel--more like a 3.5 stars at most. I say this because while the rooms were clean, everything seemed like it was getting old. This place needs to undergo some renovations. However, that aisde, it was a wonderful stay! The bed was comfy, but I did not like that there was just a untucked sheet covering the matress; that was werid. I liked the hotel key for the room, reminded me of an old botique house. I definitely recommend this place because it was clean and the hotel is perfectly located. However, only stay here if you get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lune14
Reviews.Content: Paying too much emphasis on its location take away some merit of the Sutton itself. I was prepared for an older somewhat rundown hotel, but I was pleased too find a roomy Sutton King with a great bed, fresh and clean bathroom with great beauty products (G&S). The only old piece in the room was the TV set, but signal was quite good, and who goes to Chicago to watch TV anyway? Now, the location is not only great, it is awesome! It's the highest concentration of restaurants and bars anywhere in Chicago. Starting off at breakfast, your choices span from the little kiosk in the corner park (Whisper, great fresh OJ) to the long queues at the Original Pancake House to the permanently full Tavern on Rush, all this if you are not prepared to walk more than 50 yards. If you are into shopping, it's two blocks from the Mag Mile, but the real posh brands are (nearly) all around the corner in the same block of the hotel. And for the real touristy stuff, you can walk to downtown Chicago or take the L about 4 blocks away. I enjoyed this place much more than I expected and hope to be back here soon. It is not a posh 5-star hotel with turn down service, fresh flowers and chocolates in your room. But its value, location and service compete pretty well with those. One last word of advice: taking the L from O'Hare is the cheapest and one of the quickest ways to get here, but don't do this if you are heavily loaded. Nearby Clark/Division is an old station with steep flights of stairs, and I saw rolling steps in only one of the two levels.

Reviews.Title: “"Perfect Hotel in a Perfect Location"”
Reviews.Author: chas h
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! Everyone at this Hotel from the Valet to the Concierge to the Room Service was Fantastic.. This Hotels location is perfectly placed, we stayed in Chicago in Aug of 2011 and within walking distance were more than enough restaurants and Bars! I would stay at this Hotel any day of the week!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Quality, Service and Comfort!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: From the doorman to the cleaning service this hotel can only be described as perfect. Their location is perfect, the rooms and beds were immaculate, fantastic bathrooms and decor. The proximity to the nightlife and the staff's knowledge of it was amazing....I will never stay at another hotel in Chicago again. I would rather pay to stay at Sutton Place then a free stay anywhere else in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Sutton Place WAS our hotel”
Reviews.Author: jonesgunderson
Reviews.Content: We always stay here, staff is great. We took advantage of the pay in full discounted room price two months before our stay-so we were paid in full, and the experience was very disappointing. No chocolates on our pillows which we bragged about when we convinced our friends to stay here this time, no turned down beds, and it wasn't as "special" as we have felt the numerous times we have stayed before (many). One of the 3 rooms we paid in full, well in advance for, smelled strongly of smoke. Very disappointing. Something has changed...we are going to try a different hotel when we visit in a few months. We are not that old, but the bar and everything else seemed to be trendy and exploit their personal-. Very much in need of updates in the rooms as well... The place has changed but the location is great. We are moving on next time to another hotel after a decade + of stays here. Sincerely, J&E

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Payter
Reviews.Content: We almost always stay at the Sutton Place in Chicago when we visit. The location is great and the service is always top notch. There are fancier places in the city, but Sutton Place combines value, service and location better than most.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with need for minor improvements.”
Reviews.Author: MIAeddie
Reviews.Content: First off, the staff at the Sutton was fabulous from the doorman, valet and front desk to the room service delivery staff. If I where to base this review solely off customer service, I'd rate it a solid 5. However, my room did show some signs of age. When staying in room 814 I noticed there to be faulty extension chords behind the television set, only the left speaker in the room worked, and the shower appeared to be broken. Only after really messing with it did I get it to work, with less than acceptable water temperatures though. My stay here was so short that it didn't really make or break the vacation, but had my stay been longer I would have kindly requested to be moved. Also, the room was billed as a deluxe lakeview however being on the 8th floor only really provided a view to neighboring buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chicagokris
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights starting August 13th. I agree with most of the other posts. The hotel is in a great location. The service was top notch. We had a corner mini suite and I only wish it was on a higher floor to be able to take advantage of the 2 walls of windows. We were on the 11th floor and although the view was ok, it was mainly buildings and parking lots. The ice situation is sad....my husband had been sent a bucket of beers as a gift, but the ice melted after a few hours and the beers got warm. The next day we called for ice, got a tiny bucket of it and told the guy we needed much more. He finally brought up another big bucket, but still, by the next morning it had mainly melted. So keep in mind, there is no way to bring your own drink and keep it cold. (maybe I'm just spoiled with ice machnes on at least every other floor) We also had to pay the $45 per night parking fee. Ouch! But I guess you're paying for the neighborhood which was great. My only complaint was not being able to see my hotel bill on the TV. Every time I tried I got a message that it was unavailable.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place with very nice employees”
Reviews.Author: gavinssidekick
Reviews.Content: If I had just one thing to say negative about this place would be the lack of WiFi. Rooms very nice, clean. Pets allowed which was very nice and centrally located which is even nicer. Great people watching location. Close to the beach as well as plenty of fine restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: veerhere
Reviews.Content: I love Chicago over New York. The architecture, the people, great restaurants .... the windy city rocks. Stayed at the Sutton Place Hotel which was central to the waterfront and beach volleyball tournament. It was a first stay at the Sutton and would recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff were pleasant and helpful, the rooms well appointed and comfortable. Surrounded by great restaurants and a small park area which sells great gelato. In other words .... perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HavanaBob
Reviews.Content: A good rate for this area of Chicago. Clean and very polite and helpful staff. The best part of this hotel is the location. Right on Rush St. so tons of great restaurants. Walking distance to a great deal of the best attractions and really close to the Mag Mile.

Reviews.Title: “A nice find in a nice area.”
Reviews.Author: Baycruisers
Reviews.Content: We were booked for 3 nights at the Sutton to attend a wedding. We got a good rate because we were part of a block of rooms. Our king-sized room overlooked Bellvue Avenue, and we had a nice view from the 7th floor. The room was spacious and well appointed, although the TV was an older box model. We weren't there for TV so we didn't really care. There is a home entertainment system with separate speakers (!) built in, but again, we didn't use it. Like most hotels, unused electrical outlets are a bit scarce so plan accordingly if you're bringing laptops, chargers, etc. Although the hotel charges for wifi, you can get it for free by signing up online for the Sutton chain's rewards program. Our wifi signal was strong and reliable, and it was a bonus that it was free. Being familiar with Chicago we didn't need concierge service. Valet parking was quick and all of the staff were friendly and responsive, especially housekeeping. Ice is available only from room service. There is a honor bar in the room. The hotel is conveniently located just a few blocks from the Magnificent Mile, if that's your thing, and there are some good restaurants (Luxbar, Original Pancake House, and Hunt Club) literally across the street. One of our party tried the Whiskey Bar, part of the Sutton, and was very disappointed in her breakfast. Service was poor because they one waitress and reportedly one person in the kitchen. People were walking out because the wait was too long. The food was not that good, according to our friend, certainly not worth the wait when there were better places across the street. We will certainly consider staying here again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Will absolutely stay again”
Reviews.Author: ellis000
Reviews.Content: First class service. When I arrived at 11am they said my room would not be available for a few hours, but they offered me a significant upgrade to a suite for a nominal fee that was immediately available. The room was beautiful with a very comfortable bed and roomy bathroom. I will absolutely stay here again on my next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Serene, yet near Rush Street”
Reviews.Author: Justsaygo13
Reviews.Content: Hotel is extremely nice and near many upscale restaurants, including Gibson's one of the best steakhouses in the area. Nightlife, outside dining, and even a few casual places like the Pancake House, Corner Bakery and Lou Malnati's are right there. Our room was on the 18th floor with a nice view. The bathroom was exceptional and the bed was very comfortable. The only negatives were: no coffee in the room (however one only has to go to the lobby, as they have free coffee set up until 10:00am). The other negative was we had to call for ice; they brought it up quickly each time, but we were there during a heat wave so it was a bit annoying. The location is at the north end of the Gold Coast, so we took the #151 bus on Michigan Ave to go south where many of the tourist attractions are located. The staff was very professional; Chris, the bell captain was exceptional, he always greeted and spoke to us even though we were only coming or going to the hotel from other activities. Overall, a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Traveler3933
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our six year old granddaughter. The location was excellent; we had an easy walk to the American Girl Store and other attractions on Michigan Avenue. We upgraded to a corner room with views of both the lake and the city. I originally balked at the $40 upgrade price but it proved to be well worth it. The staff could not have been more accommodating and they treated our granddaughter like royalty. The lobby was on the small side but that really didn't matter to us. We would definitely stay at Sutton Place again.

Reviews.Title: “Our preferred hotel”
Reviews.Author: HeartlandHoosier
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many, many hotels in Chicago Magnificent Mile area...and keep coming back to the many attributes of Sutton Place Hotel that make it a preferred choice. It is a perfect location: near the intersection of Oak & Rush. It is not on Michigan Avenue- imakes it much quieter and we love the neighborhood feel. It is smaller and more of a boutique hotel- you don't have to walk a mile from the front desk to get to your room. Their kitchen is terrific- we love the food on the fairly extensive room menu. A bonus when you are tired and want to stay in! Great shower with water pressure! Bathrooms are slightly dated but good. Gary, the doorman, is a true delight!

Reviews.Title: “mixed reviews”
Reviews.Author: NEW71
Reviews.Content: while the location of the sutton place is perfect for business and pleasure, i was not impressed with the staff (other than alex at the front desk, kudos to him and andrew the bellman, such a delight). otherwise they were not friendly or helpful. the doorman said he had gotten my bags from the cab and when i got in, my large suitcase was still in the taxi. it took 2 hours to retrieve with no help from the staff. there was another issue where they were going to call me and never did for a billing issue, i had to go down 3 times. the room was nice, clean and comfortable but for the price, the location it's best quality. if you appreciate service with a smile, the sutton

Reviews.Title: “Loved the rooms! Would probably go back.”
Reviews.Author: Cbowsk
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for my birthday with 2 friends visiting from out of town . The rooms were huge. They were VERY clean and the jacuzzi bathtub was a huge plus. We really had a good time hanging out in the room. There is so much around the hotel that you can never get bored. I love River North area but it is definitely pricey. The hotel is not cheap either, but I got a deal from a daily deal website.

Reviews.Title: “It really is that bad!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: amfletch
Reviews.Content: We checked in and noticed a huge part of the carpet was soaking wet. When we called the front desk to report the problem, they basically accused us of making it happen by flooding the bathroom (granted we wouldn't have even had time to take a shower). They moved us to room #2 which smelled like an ashtray -- unacceptable. Again it seemed as this was OUR problem and not theirs. The Bellman was trying to be accommodating, however without the management's support it was not working. Room #3 was dry, didn't smell, but the TV wasn't working... Engineering came up to try and fix, still no apologies from management! We would have expected an upgrade or something at this point, but did not receive so much as an apology!!!! I would NEVER stay here again and recommend you don't either!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, quiet rooms with a killer location”
Reviews.Author: lovesitaly96
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Sutton and found it to have the qualities we value in a hotel: quiet rooms with great beds, good housekeeping and elegant decor. The staff was helpful; but not really friendly. The location is great. It is located in the entertainment/restaurant hub of the Gold Coast. Fine dining abounds and is walkable. The neighborhood is lively and the people watching is great. We particularly enjoyed walking around the residential streets and many area parks. It is close to downtown and very near the Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Sutton Place-Chicago. Nice, maybe a bit over-priced”
Reviews.Author: idries
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sutton Place for one night in July of 2011. I walked in at about 1AM looking for availability (visiting someone in the hospital and needed a place to crash) which thankfully they had! The location is actually excellent. Very convenient to all the sights and sounds of the magnificent mile. My first impression was that the lobby was rather small and it smelled of cigarettes. This made me a bit apprehensive about what the room would be like but it was just a place to crash for the night. The single bedded king room was $199 for the night plus tax and the 24-hour valet parking was $45. Not horribly expensive especially for the location but you can definitely find some cheaper options in the area. The room itself was small but nice. Modern amenities and in-room movies. Bathroom was actually quite large and well stocked (bathroom could have been smaller with a larger room). I was exhausted and enjoyed a good nights sleep. Room was quite and the bed was comfortable. The staff was very nice and polite and responsive to our needs/requests. They only had one bedded rooms available but they quickly brought a roll away bed up for us. Checkout was quick and efficient and the concierge kept my bag so that I would not have to lug it around the city. I am a big fan a larger, chain hotels but overall, I can recommend Sutton Place Chicago. Relatively reasonably priced with nice (though small) rooms and polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, amenities and attitudes need a little work”
Reviews.Author: dcsunny
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation through Hotwire, so I was thrilled to get a 4-star hotel for a cheap-as-all-get-out price. The room itself was gorgeous--large, corner space with almost floor to ceiling windows. Nice soaking tub AND shower with adjustable water flow. What was lacking was the usual congenial attitude of most Chicagoans, especially those in the service industry. Heck, I'm from there, so I expect nothing less. The desk staff, as well as the concierge, parking valet, etc. were not helpful at all and, in some cases, were downright rude. I didn't really witness any interaction with other lodgers, so maybe they treat only the cheapskates who don't pay full price poorly. But really, now. The desk staff were downright chilly. We were offered no assistance with our luggage, either coming or going. We had to hail our own cab on departure, as the doorman was too busy chatting with another employee, and had to load our luggage into the trunk. I don't mind doing all these things myself, but heck, it's a 4-star hotel and I tip pretty good if I do say so myself. Also, if you are staying there with kids, beware that there are no kid's channels on the TV. No Disney, no Nick. You can, however, pay $9.99 a day to get 6 episodes of a show from one of those channels. Usually, having no kids' channel is a good in my book, but the whole having to pay extra thing rubbed me the wrong way. Even worse, they also had some bait and switch going on with their movie offerings. Everything that was advertised as $4.99, was actually $12.99 when it came time to purchase it. When I complained to the desk, they sent up the Engineer (no, really, the Engineer), who was just as baffled as I was. He told me he would look into it but, of course, I never heard back from anyone again. So now I forget why I gave this place a 3 rating...OK, the bell captain was very nice and helpful, the property is nice and clean, and the location is great and easy walking distance to Oak Street beach. If you can stay there cheap, I'd highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: HoneyBunny0811
Reviews.Content: A one night stay in a nice hotel with a great view. The hotel is in the Gold Coast area, walking distance from Michigan Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time despite the snowstorm”
Reviews.Author: OilerFans
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for location , service and cleanliness. The food was not the best , but not terrible.Just across the street from Carmine's and Hugo Frogs. We had a great stay there, and only a few blocks from the Magnificent Mile for shopping,

Reviews.Title: “Great town...great hotel”
Reviews.Author: katqe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sutton Place Hotel Chicago in mid-May and it was great. My husband and I were celebrating our birthdays and the staff at the hotel went out of their way to make us feel special. We had a fantastic corner suite on the 21st floor. Great king bed (very comfortable after a day of sightseeing), plenty of space (it was bigger than our downtown Toronto condo!), lots of natural light and oh so peaceful. The bathroom decor was a bit dated but it was very clean and functional (separate glass shower). We had breakfast in the restaurant one day (very good) and ordered in room service breakfast for our other two mornings (prompt and hot). We also had free internet (not sure if this was a Prestige Member thing or if it was free to all guests) and we loved the big safe (perfect for our large laptop). The front desk was good, concierge was super helpful, bellmen were so friendly and courteous. The area was a hub-bub of activity. Lots of restaurants. Very safe. Shopping was close by too (much to the regret of my handsome husband who hates shopping). Thanks to all the staff at the Sutton Place Chicago...we had such a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: Dancingblackbear
Reviews.Content: Dated. Dirty with stains on floor. Room was smoked in and all my belongings stunk of cigarette smoke. Don't plan on coming back. I have stayed in 4 star hotels and this is not 4 star worthy.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Dame”
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at this hotel. This hotel is located within walking distance to great restaurants and fabulous shopping. The staff at this hotel were very helpful. We had an issue our first night which was quickly resolved. Mark (Concierge) was knowledgeable and helpful...he was just a gem. Our suite was a bit dated but very comfortable and large. We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant a few times and it was nice and quiet. Overall we had a great stay and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed...”
Reviews.Author: Mandy1227
Reviews.Content: Well, I am truly unable to provide a review of the rooms and such but I had booked our hotel stay in March for a weekend in mid-May. I confirmed our reservations the week of our trip (4 days prior to our arrival). I was really excited to be able to stay in this hotel with my husband and was looking forward to spending time at the Whiskey Bar and Grill on site but this did not occur. Upon our arrival we were told, "we have a slight situation". Due to the Chicago Bulls basketball team winning a game on Thursday night (and not playing again until Sunday) the team was contracted to stay at this hotel. Our stay was to be from Friday to Sunday but were kicked out due to the ball team getting the first accommodations. I really wished the hotel would have told me that this was a possibility when I called about the reservations (they had to have known in advance that this was possibly going to happen). Anyway, the hotel and driver re-accomodated at another hotel and paid for our hotel stay which was nice but not really that easy of a story. They sent us to "White Hall" which is supposedly a 4 star hotel. NOT! The paint was peeling off the walls and the decor was from the 80's. Nothing about this was pleasing. We checked in, seen the room, and were disgusted. We went back to Sutton Place to inform them that those accommodations would not work. They then accommodated us at the Talbot. I loved the Talbot and so glad we did complain to get an enjoyable stay and such a nice place. We will definitely be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Find in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: JackEWadd
Reviews.Content: Barbara & I stayed at the Sutton Place Hotel Easter weekend & found that the hotel is a very pleasant experience. The rooms are large & everything is new. The service was excellent (a call to the front desk to inquire about the purchase of a newspaper rought the following response, "We do have complimentary newspapers for all guests - would you like for me to have one delivered immediately to your room?" - nice), the location is the north edge of Magnificent Mile & you can eat at Gibsons's, Hugo Frog's, the Original Pancake House, etc. A small bar in the hotel serves a nice adult beverage after hoofing it around Chicago during the day. Lovely, just lovely. Parking at $45 per day is difficult to swollow... but this is Chicago! In & out at no additional charge if that makes a difference to you.

Reviews.Title: “Near Perfect! Just one surly desk clerk...”
Reviews.Author: longball4
Reviews.Content: Rooms were great and hotel was spotless. The doorman and bell staff were excellent and knew alot about the area and how to get around. Got to see a regular room, and a PH suite with 2 floors...nice! The downside...PARKING $45 a night. Then 2 cars were charged to our room when we only had one, and low and behold the desk clerk wanted to argue about it?? Not sure what that was about, but it was moronic! Overall, a good time was had by all and you can't beat this hotel for it's perfect location within walking distance of everything!

Reviews.Title: “5 bedbug bites on the first night!”
Reviews.Author: veggieyoga
Reviews.Content: Its a very nice hotel and overall I enjoyed the place, but I got 5 bed bug bites on the first night. I had to be moved to a completely different floor, room and across the hall. They upgraded my room. I dont think this should deter you but I would say CHECK THE BED before you commit to the room. The staff was great about the whole thing. I was a bit freaked out but that's just because its creepy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GBontheroad
Reviews.Content: I brought two 9 year old girls (my daughter and her friend) to The Sutton Place Hotel, for their American Girl package. The package was nice, and the girls really enjoyed it. We loved the location (easy walking distance to the Mag. Mile) and great food within easy walking distance. What set this hotel apart was the service. I'd read about it in a lot of these reviews, and it was apparent from the time I pulled into the hotel until I left. The employee's were simply fantastic! Thank you Sutton Place Staff! We will be back, good value for the price

Reviews.Title: “The Sutton Stay”
Reviews.Author: TVtravelLA
Reviews.Content: First off I would like to say that I have stayed at this hotel many times while visiting Chicago for business. It is in a perfect area surrounded by many restaurants and shops for those who have time to shop. When the weather is warm enough it's close enough to enjoy the lake if you're looking for a nice stroll or need to get a little workout in. Overall location and conveniences the hotel offers are pretty paramount. My recent stay was good. Not great, but good. Nothing so bad happened that I wouldn't stay at this property again but there are a few glitches that make you go ummmm. Remember, I stay here mainly for the location and partly for everything else. Upon check in, I felt like I was kind of bothering the front desk people. There was a tinge of attitude like I should be thankful for staying at the property. Not unfriendly, just not feeling like these people would go above and beyond for you. Fine. Whatever. It's not like I rely on them for much any way. The rooms: The rooms themselves are nice and fairly spacious. The decor in the bed-room is decent and up to date but the bathroom. That's a whole other story. For the times I have spent at this property, I say the same thing to myself. This bathroom is in dire need of an update. Literally I don't think its changed since 1984 when the hotel was probably built. Horrible dated tiles. Horrible dated fixtures. Things work but the bathroom is laughable. It would be a good candidate for a makeover show. With all the competition out there for hotel dollars in the area you would think they would make an effort to update. Now it's just sounding funny. My last complaint is also a service complaint. I went down for breakfast at a normal breakfast hour and waited FOREVER to be seated. There wasn't anyone running the place. I had to look around for someone to help me as did another hotel employee. It looked like no one in the place was being helped. And once someone did, they didn't have any sort of apologetic attitude. I guess it was only this one person running everything and wouldn't be surprised if he was also preparing the food in the back. Again, a hotel of this caliber should not have these kind of service problems. Oh and I forgot from my previous stays how weak the wireless is. You literally have to find the one spot in the room where it works flawlessly. I travel all over the country and stay at many different properties. This kind of falls in between what's on the high end and what's on the lower end of my spectrum. Not the worst place but I might try another property in the area. I don't want to be reminded of Less Than Zero every time I walk in the bathroom. Great location and comfortability do keep me coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Short but nice stay at Sutton Place Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fern60514
Reviews.Content: We booked one night at the Sutton Place Hotel due to a GroupOn deal that we saw offered. One night for $119 plus 1/2 off the valet for the car. We stayed the weekend of the St. Patrick's Day parade (which I didn't realize when we booked...) so the neighborhood was pretty busy. This is a great location if you want to be close to bars/clubs, good restaurants, shopping on Oak, Rush and close walk to Michigan Ave. Room was very nice, clean, modern, very roomy bathroom. Only issues were with service, we stopped with friends on late Sat afternoon to have a drink and waited over 20 minutes to get served -had to move into the main bar that faces Rush street to get served. Then on Sunday when we were leaving, we had to wait about 30 minutes for our car to be retrieved from valet so we could leave.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to EVERYTHING!!”
Reviews.Author: brent_owens
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing. Everything went smoothly from check in to check out. The room was amazing. I had a great view of the city, and it was a spacious room. The bathroom was nice and big as well. I did not feel cramped for space at all. The staff was very courteous. I forgot to pack a couple of toiletry items, and the bellman ran up some free ones right away. The hotel is close to everything. There were a lot of great restaurants and bars around. The Whiskey Bar restaurant in the hotel was amazing. The food was great and the staff there were very courteous as well. I will definitely be staying here again when I come back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place...”
Reviews.Author: Jeffwhatever
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last 4th of July weekend and really took a liking to this hotel. Rooms are clean and modern, not what I would consider luxurious, but nice. Bathrooms are huge with both a walk-in shower and a separate tub. Floor to ceiling windows. The absolute best thing about this hotel is it's location. Great bars and restaurants right outside the front door. In the summer time this whole area is just crawling with party people. If you're into nightlife, stay at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: birdfarm
Reviews.Content: I had just recently stayed in a Four Seasons so perhaps I was spoiled, but the room was extremely plain and not very big - not very conducive to romance. It was also very cold. The mini bar was not cold (I think it was a wine storage thing and not a fridge), and the TV was a mess - the DVD player wasn't hooked up right and the surround sound was broken. The engineer came up (great service there) to do what he could for it and it helped, but the surround sound was still broken. Not that I would have minded not having it at all, but having it there and broken just made the whole thing seem tawdry. 24-hour room service was great - we had chicken wings in the middle of the night and they were done perfectly - golden crispy, yum. Location is perfect for shopping etc. but there are a lot of hotels around there - try another one.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC stay, impeccable service, perfect location -- highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: torontojen83
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Sutton Place Chicago was excellent in every way. Rooms were immaculate, views were spectacular, and staff were incredibly helpful and friendly, eager to meet every need and answer any request. Shopping and dining options abound in the immediate area and within walking distance; the location is generally excellent as a jumping-off point for exploring Chicago. I have stayed at many four-star hotels in the US and I would recommend this hotel without hesitation. Absolutely everything about our stay was positive and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Experience - no heat, no hot water, lies lies lies”
Reviews.Author: cubfanjim
Reviews.Content: Arrive Friday afternoon: no hot water...90 minutes of workman in room to change a mixing valve. Come back from dinner...room 95 degrees and heat will not turn off; workman in room at midnight. Wake up next morning...NO HEAT. Workman in room at 8am Return for day at 4pm to get dressed for a wedding....95 degrees and heat will not turn off. We had two rooms on the same floor (one for us, one for kids age 7, 12 and 15) and they could not accomodate a move of both rooms to the same floor, so we were stuck. Front office was rude, said they "went above and beyond" (since when is hot water and 72 degree air considered "above and beyond" and that we refused to move rooms. A lie. PLUS, I don't get how people can say the decor is clean and modern. It has not been changed since the building was built 20+ years ago, the bathroom tiles are chipped with dirty grout, and there are NOT flat screen TVs in every room as their website advertises. It is a great location near Michigan Ave and the pancake house, but find another nearby hotel. Repeat: AWFUL!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Hotel at ultra low price!”
Reviews.Author: ancjac
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on several occasions and have been impressed each time. With the welcoming staff and beautiful accommodations, i feel like this is my home away from home in Chicago! Sutton Place is located within walking distance to the Water Tower shopping center, other great stores and fine dining establishments. Value -The pricing of rooms is EXTREMELY reasonable. -Wi-fi is available at low to no cost. -The only thing that has a "city" price is the valet parking. However, you don't have to pay each time you take your vehicle out- just a daily price. Quality -Luxurious bath products -Sleeping arrangements are so comfortable, you feel like royalty -Delicious in-room dining options (who doesn't want chocolate souffle at midnight?) Next time I venture to Chicago, I will stay at Sutton Place! Love it :)

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in the Society”
Reviews.Author: westie78
Reviews.Content: We love the location of the quiet, sophisticated hotel. The service is excellent. The rooms are immaculate and comfortable with attractive modern decor. It is in an excellent location.I would give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced luxury”
Reviews.Author: nester4866
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Sutton Place many times around 15 years ago. We tried it when the Marriott, Westin and similar hotels were booked. I was nervous at first because I'd never heard of it. What a surprise. The location is great, close to Mich Ave but on a private street. The service is great, they are friendly but not in an annoying begging for tips way. The bed was great; my wife and i fell asleep one afternoon just laying down watching TV which never happens to me. The truth is that Chicago is an expensive town and a lot of the bigger luxury hotels have a lot of activity going on. This hotel is smaller so the front desk is easier to get in and out of, the rooms are quicker to get to, the car access is easier. All in all, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: innovativematt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Sutton Place during a New Year's trip to Chicago with my wife. Being on the north end of downtown, we were a little concerned that walking to our individual destinations wouldn't be as feasible as we wanted. We were pleasantly surprised to find that the location was very conducive to seeing the city with numerous nearby shops and restaurants. The train was also conveniently nearby when needed. The service was excellent. The staff was very responsive and offered a sincere, warm bidding everytime we came and went. We even returned to a surprise treat in our room on New Year's Eve. Our Junior Suite was superb. It was clean and comfortable from the bed to the bathroom. We look forward to staying at The Sutton Place on our next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The view from our 22nd floor room was gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: geebeemarie
Reviews.Content: I am an online member of SniqueAway, a website that offers discounted prices on trips and hotel stay for places that normally cost a ridiculous amount of $. I found a deal for The Sutton Place Hotel, a room with double beds one night for more than affordable. The dates of availability were not offered during the time of my planned trip so I contacted someone from the hotel and Debbie Debbie Vansen Block, Director of Revenue Management not only replied immediately but honored the discounted price during a non sales time and she also made my reservation for me no questions asked! Impressive. My friends and I stayed on the 22nd floor with a view of downtown Chicago that took our breath away. We kept our curtains open during the entire 24 hour stay. In the evening when all the buildings were lit, we marveled at the view from our room. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and accommodating. We left something in our car and the valet guys walked us to our parked car and allowed us to retrieve left behind items, friendly as could be. The bathrooms were spacious and clean. We loved the bathrobes hanging for our use. Our beds were comfy and we all slept well. No need to buy a wine corkscrew as all rooms come with bar accommodations, including wine glasses. Check in as at 3pm and check out is noon the next day; this gave up plenty of time to visit the city and then sleep in the next day. My only concerns were: room temperature, it was so warm even after we turned down the heat, immensely. At one point we turned on the air conditioner and our stay was during the month of December. Secondly, I was under the impression all rooms were free wifi, I had to opt to pay for internet use, which I needed since I was also working during my visit to Chicago. I'm not too terribly upset as I was never charged. Just a heads up. The location was fabulous! There were plenty of places to shop (the hotel is located one block away from Prada), eat (we had a lovely and pricey dinner at a Mexican rest a few blocks east of the hotel), and visit. We had breakfast across the street at a pancake house which was quite convenient. I plan on staying again at The Sutton Place next time I'm in Chicago! Wouldn't dream of resting anywhere else. We had that good of an experience, thank you Sutton Place for making our stay grande!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but doesn't make up for the bad service.”
Reviews.Author: Shalala973
Reviews.Content: The Sutton Place is in a great locaiton for the traveler that wants to experience many fine restaurants. It's just across the street from Gibson's Steakhouse, The Tavern on Rush, LuxBar, Hugo's Frog Bar, Morton's Steadhouse and Dublin's Bar. It's walking distance to great shopping on Michigan Ave. We loved the location because at night after dinner and drinks, the room was just a short walk. The downfall of this hotel is the poor service and the miscommunication between staff over the New Year's holiday. First when we checked in we did not receive any information about the room service package that we booked on hotels.com. It wasn't until check out when we saw the charges that it was explained to us. Almost all of it was then credited. We were then charged for parking two cars at the wrong rate even though we only drove one. This was then credited but after much confusion and explanation. Then on New Year's the bartender at The Whiskey, which is attached to the hotel, told us we could come back that night and hang out at the bar. There is nice area with leather couches that she said would be open. So when we came back that night they had decided to "reserve" the area and not let anyone without a New Year's Party ticket into it. The area sat mostly empty and the hotel was losing sales but they wouldn't let anyone into it. The hotel was hosting a New Year's party which was attended by many young kids, probably why the bar couches were empty - the kids couldn't drink. When we inquired at the front desk we were told that we had to ask the bar manager, but yet no one would answer at the bar. The front desk then sent us to find the bar manager ourselves, which was ridiculous. The service was poor and the servcie staff was incompetent. I could not in good conscience recommend this hotel to a friend unless you were getting a really low rate. The rooms were fine and the location spectacular, but.... I wonder if the service would have been better had it not been New Years. Overall the hotel was a disappointment. There are too many choices in Chicago - stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “American Girl Package was incredible”
Reviews.Author: HartmanTraveler
Reviews.Content: from the moment we arrived until the very moment of our checkout the hotel made this trip for our five-year-old daughter when she will no doubt remember for a lifetime, we will remember it likely just as fondly. We arranged to take advantage of their American girl package as one of the reasons we were going to Chicago was to purchase the tall for our daughter. The staff were welcoming and made us feel very special, especially the room service waitress who arrived "asking where's the Princess?" When she delivered the American girl breakfast. there was a traveling crib for the doll and daily videos. We couldn't have asked for more and highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value No Hassle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wearethemods-cz
Reviews.Content: For a city centre hotel with decent size, very comfortable rooms and everything you need within a short distance, you can't knock this place. This is a solid four star with helpful staff and reasonable room service food prices.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic stay...perfect location...great room...wonderful staff...”
Reviews.Author: dans165312
Reviews.Content: My girlfried and I had a great weekend staying at The Sutton Place in Chicago. It is smack in the middle of the Rush/State St nightlfe where some of the best resturants, bars, and nightclubs in Chicago are located and also within seconds of great shopping and Michigan Ave. The staff was very attentive and the room (especially the bed and bedding) was fantastic. The hotel is also an elegant choice for a relaxing stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “My husband's wedding ring was taken from our room, and hotel doesn't seem to care.”
Reviews.Author: jessb415
Reviews.Content: The only positive was the location. Fabulous location, very central and easy to get anywhere. The hotel itself was just okay, rather outdated, but nothing I would have complained about if I hadn't had such a bad experience with them regarding my husband's wedding ring. WARNING - don't leave anything behind in your room! We checked out, left for one hour, realized my husband had left his ring (I knew exactly where it was). Went back, room had just been cleaned, and ring was gone. Hotel didn't seem to care. They launched an "investigation" which resulted in me getting a cold letter saying that they won't do anything because the result of their investigation shows they are not at fault. So, just a warning. There are plenty of other hotels that are well located where your stuff won't get stolen.

Reviews.Title: “Third time was not a charm!! Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: californian2009
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at Sutton Place twice before and enjoyed its location and especially the view from the corner rooms. However, we always found the front desk staff cold and aloof. This visit we received no help from the Bell man coming or going. The staff response to complaints of noise, which included people talking loudly in the hallways till 4 AM was to turn their backs and make us feel unwelcome for remarking on the noise and our lack of sleep. I have never felt the hotel deserved a "choice" award, this time they don't even deserve a star. We have stayed at many hotels in Chicago downtown over the last 30 years. There are many excellent choices which provide gracious service whether low priced or high. I would suggest you pick somewhere else than the Sutton Place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the heart of Gold Coast”
Reviews.Author: BostonTraveller82
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved Sutton Place... stayed there for one night in a wedding block of rooms. Every employee treated us with the utmost care and service. The room was pretty big & modern, with quite possibly the most comfortable hotel bed I've every stayed in! Great location on Rush, near tons of steakhouses, bars, cafes, restaurants, and very good shopping. Would definitely reccomend!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, wonderful views, quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: CountryGirl12
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for our son's wedding and the Sutton Place was a nearly perfect for our stay. We were close to dining, shopping and sight seeing. The door staff, particularly Wendell was just a doll to everyone in our family, helping my elderly father-in-law out the door and into taxi's and always giving us a hearty greeting. Our Deluxe King room overlooked the lake and was very quiet and extremely comfortable. My only complaint was the lack of an ice machine on the floor and coffee in the room. Although it was advertised that we got 2 cleanings daily, there was only evidence of a second. It would have been great to have a turndown service as the second visit with ice provided then, in lieu of a machine. And I don't want to always get dressed and out the door for a simple cup of coffee in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, relaxed place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Drake_Sheldon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2009 on a trip to the States and we had no problems with this hotel. We got this hotel though Expedia before we arrived in the U.S. and were not disappointed. Check-in was smooth and quick - we arrived quite late because of dalays with out flight from JFK but the staff were efficient and friendly. The hotel is located a bit of a way from the down down/city centre part of Chicago, however this isn't a problem as it is only a couple of subway stops to the centre. The room was spacious and very comfortable as you would expect from most American hotel rooms. There was a complimentary voucher for the restaurant around the corner - Henry's Frog Bar & Fish - which gives you a free desert. We chose the slice of chocolate cake which is HUGE; not bad if you've only paid for two starters. Not a bad hotel by any means, and I would easily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Caution to non-smokers”
Reviews.Author: kaseysmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a tremendous location with restaurants, nightlife, beautiful neighborhoods and shopping all a short walk away. So, we were very optimistic about this hotel. Check in went well with very nice people assisting from the front door to the front desk. Unfortunately, when we got off the elevator and went to our room, we were hit by the smell of cigarette smoke. The smell was only slightly less prominent in our corner suite at the end of the hallway. We immediately called the front desk and asked if we had accidently been placed in a smoking room and could they move us. After several phone calls to the front desk we were told that the hotel was booked and the best they could do was refresh the room for us - which turned out to be a spray with Glade (which we held onto and frequently used over the weekend as the smoking continued in the rooms down the hall). Very disappointing. Fortunately, it was a beautiful weekend in Chicago and we minimized our time in the room. Other comments: stained carpets, old bathroom but very comfy bed.

Reviews.Title: “Started Strong; Ended Less So.”
Reviews.Author: twj410
Reviews.Content: The Sutton Place Hotel is a nice hotel located in a very nice area of Chicago. We greatly enjoyed the location and its nearby public transportation, dining, and nightlife. Upon check-in, on a weekday, the staff was welcoming, helpful, alert to our needs, and friendly. Very friendly. The doormen were always there to open the door or grab a taxi. By the weekend, however, the service greatly declined. On Saturday, housekeeping never cleaned our room until after 5pm--and then only replaced the towels and made the bed. Empty water bottles were never thrown out and no one put the iron and ironing board away. This was in stark contrast to the quality of the room cleaning on Friday; and a disappointing way to return to our room later Saturday evening. Upon check out on Sunday, there was a wait to check out as only one person appeared to be working the front desk. The concierge seemed confused when we asked to leave our luggage at the hotel while we went to lunch, and no one seemed to be available to hail a cab for us. Otherwise, the rooms were generally clean and comfortable. Our room was large with a nice television (although a flat screen, it was not in HD) and floor-to-ceiling windows. The bathroom featured a large soaking tub and separate shower; but the fixtures seemed straight out of the 1980's. The lobby, although small, featured morning coffee and easy access to the on-site restaurant/lounge. The nearness of the restaurant announced its presence, though, with the continuous smell of cooking grease in the lobby and elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, fabulous, welcoming door staff”
Reviews.Author: IrishGirl26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early September for my brother's wedding. Firstly, the location of this hotel cannot be beaten. Fantastic bars and restaurants right outside the door and you're only a few minutes walk from the beach and the Mag Mile. As well as the location what really stood out for me were the fantastic door staff - they were so friendly and welcoming, in particular The G Man (Geary), Samuel and Luis, but each was charming and attentive. I wasn't as impressed with the front desk staff unfortunately but had little dealings with them after an initial mess up when six rooms had been booked in my aunt's name (the hotel's fault, she clearly only required one). When I queried this I was told abruptly that there may be an extra charge and I had to go up again to ensure that this wasn't the case. Anyway that was really a minor glitch in what was a great stay. The rooms are really nice though perhaps in need of a little updating/freshening up. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “lived up to reviews!”
Reviews.Author: inrbty
Reviews.Content: Husband and I, along with another couple, stayed here to begin a month-long vacation traveling East across the country. Turned out to be a great first Hotel on our journey. Front-desk staff were friendly and helpful. We stayed in a corner room (1014) with views of Lake Michigan. Could see The Hancock and The Drake Hotel from our room. Wonderful sunrises each morning! Two walls of windows really made a difference in the feeling of spaciousness and light in the room. VERY NICE! Room was spacious and comfortable and very, very clean. Bathroom was comfortable and well-planned. Climate control in room was quiet and efficient. We loved the corner the hotel was located on. It felt intimate and safe with a light energy since several restaurants are there and everyone was eating outdoors-cafe style late into the evening every night. Even a little gelatto place in a park-like setting caddy-corner across the street. Twinkling lights at night---a wonderful scene. We felt connected to downtown Chicago and yet, somehow a little bit removed and more intimate..This location is just at the beginning of The Gold Coast--the up-scale neighborhood to the north. So, this is a good looking area and it feels safe. We fell in love with Carmines Italian restaurant. The quality of the food was excellent but the price tag moderate. Service-- warm, friendly and attentive. Since we were planning to eat out every meal for a month-we were mindful of the expense. We avoided near-by and well-known Mortens and Gibsons because of the cost. So, Carmines was a nice surprise for us. A large menu with variety. The package deal I arranged through Perfect Escapes included breakfast at the Hotel. Turned out not to be as advertised-not a full breakfast buffet. But, we were satisfied with the quality of a small plate of very fresh and fresh-cut fruit, with fresh squeezed-YES! FRESH SQUEEZED orange juice , tea or coffee and a bagel, muffin or toast. On our last day we "splurged" and ate a real big wonderful breakfast at The Pancake House across from the Hotel. GREAT! Line-up early it's packed always. Now we know why. Needless to say, just the next block begins outrageously beautiful designer shopping opportunities. LADIES bring a few grand and plan to buy your new clothes here and along the Magnificent Mile. Window shopping as we skipped down the MILE to reach other destinations was fun. The Sutton Place Hotel is perfectly located for those of us who prefer to walk a few miles each day..it's located at the "top" end of about an actual mile to the River where you must take a CAF architectural river cruise...visit the Cultural Center for a surprisingly beautiful building...take the stairs to the top floor to see the largest Tiffany Glass dome in the world and lovely mosaic tile on the walls. Pretty! Lovely, thoughtful quotes on the walls everywhere regarding philosophy, higher learning and, of course--since this building was a library -READING. See The Palmer House. Near the El. Visit The Drake Hotel's lobby and shops. All, only if you love beautiful interiors and architecture-classical! Eat deep dish Chicago pizza at Lou Mulnattis (check the spelling) Was the best pizza our group ever tasted!! A tip from our SEE IT ALL CHICAGO tour guide. If you are into home decor, furnishings, designer linens etc---it's a must to spend hours and hours at THE MART. The showrooms are super. Everything seemed quite accessible from our location--one block to high fashion, one block to neighborhood beauty, one street to cross to eat great food!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean & comfortable room, excellent staff and service”
Reviews.Author: MichelleP_73
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Sutton Place Hotel.
