First-time visitors to Chicago, we were completely satisfied and honestly, found no faults at all with our room or the service we received there. The doorman, Gary ("G-Man") and concierge, Mark were especially friendly and helpful with their advice, but ALL the staff were courteous and efficient. The room was nicely appointed---spotless, roomy, and comfortable with a great bed and super shower. As noted by other reviewers, the location can't be beat, steps from Rush St. with its many restaurants, (very) short walk to Magnificent Mile shops and public transportation. The Sutton Place is just a bit removed from all the hustle and bustle of Michigan Avenue, but that's what we liked about it. If we ever come back to Chicago , we will DEFINITELY stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Enjoyable Experience!”
Reviews.Author: EdmAng
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying what a great location, just off of the magnificent mile, everything was in walking distance, or was close to a bus stop. The room was great, and the bathroom was amazing; there was a glass shower and a large soaker tub seperately, it was luxurious! Breakfast was included in our room package, and it was so tasty, and the portions were large. The conceirge, Mark, was so helpful... he even got us into see Oprah! On teh downside, there was no pool and there was a VERY small workout facility, like the size of a hotel room. But other than that, no compaints!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: med84
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, comfortable rooms, good location. Would definitely stay again on a return trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: Lana217
Reviews.Content: Location was good. Rooms were ok. We were near the elevator which we could hear run all day and night. By the time we checked in, all the rooms were booked and we could not change rooms (or so we were told). Since I'm a light sleeper, this was pretty annoying. We did get early check in but had 2 other mishaps. We had our "do not disturb" (or "shhhh" sign as they have) on the door and the maid still came in and cleaned while we were out for the day. When we called down they said they were sorry and that shouldn't have happened. Second, we were told 4 p.m. when we called the day before for a late check out time. Since it was my fiance's birthday, I planned our whole afternoon around this check out time. The day of check out, they said we don't have you down for a late check out, check out is 12. They said when we called down earlier, we spoke to someone in their Canadian headquarters and they gave us an incorrect time. NOT GOOD when you have surprise plans for a nice birthday lunch! And nothing was done or said but sorry. Overall, disappointed. Not good customer service at all. They need to get it together!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Great Location - Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: TheBallFlick
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location by Rush Street. Great bar named The Whiskey in the lobby. Perfect place to stay if you are visiting Chicago to shop Michigan Ave or catch a game at Wrigley.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room with great view.....”
Reviews.Author: philcharlton69
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in king double with partner. Location just a little out from centre but is in down town area with plenty of good (if pricey) restaurants and bars nearby. Hotel looks a bit tired on the outside, but once inside it is very nice. Room on 22nd floor was very good size with huge comfortable bed. Bathroom had seperate walk-in shower and was very clean, as was the bedroom. Great views over Chicago with full height windows. Staff very good. Only thing is no coffee making facilities in room and complimentry morning coffee in lobby was cold and weak, I thought americans did coffee? Overall very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Reisemaschine
Reviews.Content: The Sutton Place is an excellent hotel in a great location in Chicago. It is located right in the city center of Chicago. It offers all the service you expect from an hotel in its category. The rooms are reasonably sized, clean and nice. Moreover the hotel offers a very good bar on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but dated”
Reviews.Author: Emily080
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter during the Labour Day weekend. Love the location, within walking distance of the Magnificent Mile, good restaurants and high end shops. I will only talk about things not mentioned in previous review. Front desk gets the job done but strange and cold; concierge, doorman and bell-hop are friendly and warm. Louis & Gary are exceptional. TV is old with poor reception, like those found in roadside motel. Carpet is clean, bed is comfortable but a bit too soft for me. Pillows and duvet are lumpy. Bathroom is dated and the fluorescent lighting doesn't help, but I love the stool provided in the bathroom, and there are two foldaway luggage rack instead of one in most other hotels. There is no coffee-maker in the room. Complimentary coffee is served in the lobby only till 9 am. Starbuck is only 5 minutes walk on Rush, south from Bellevue. The Whiskey Bar & Grill downstairs are half empty all the time, so we never tried it. As for amenities, it seems like they are running on ration: no new shampoo the second day, no conditioner the third day, and only one face towel on the fourth day. The separate shower stall has very low water pressure, so the shower is not satisfying. We have the misfortune of having some very loud neighbours on the first three days, (we heard them through the door not the wall) otherwise the hotel could be quiet and restful. This is not quite a 4 star hotel due to its limited amenities. If you adjust your expectation accordingly, you will have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: BuddhaSolihull
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sutton Place for 3 nights and it was excellent. The rooms were great and the location is ideal, with great bars and restaurants close by but it is still quiet. The Pancake House opposite is great but very busy if you don't get there early. Overall an excellent stay and we got a room for Â£60 per night on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the superb hospitality and the excellant amenities”
Reviews.Author: reginababico
Reviews.Content: First of all thank you to all hotel staff that made our vacation a great memory. The staff was friendly and happy to give us the best service. The room was spacious, clean, well furnished, and we loved the delicious welcome treats. We enjoyed the hotelâ€™s location as it was within walking distance to the lake shore, Navy Pier, and the near by restaurants. The best we liked everything especially the comfortable bed and bathroom. The least we liked was the parking facility and the expensive valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Nanette53
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend staying at the Sutton Place Hotel in the Gold Coast area~ . the location was fabulous, staff was so friendly and accomodating! I had a Jr. Suite on the 19th floor that overlooked the city and was on the end so we had both views of the city. Just out the door were fabulous restaurants, Gibsons, Carmines, Tavern On Rush Michigan Avenue was just around the corner. Make sure to eat the "Original Pancake house" across the street from the Sutton Place Hotel! Great breakfast! I will definitely be back again on my next visit to Chicago. I also want to compliment the guys who worked at Valet, everyone made it such a nice experience for my time in Chicago Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Chicago Hotel choice - not deserving of the good reviews...”
Reviews.Author: livfunner
Reviews.Content: I am completely baffled by all of the good reviews, and I do not understand why this hotel would be ranked at all by Travel & Leisure. It is outdated, and probably has not been updated since 1990. As a Chicagoan I am ashamed that this would be a place that would be recommended to stay in this wonderful city. Nearby is the Sofitel, and Four Seasons which are not that much more expensive and have much better service. The Sutton Place is small and not charming and the service is non-existent. Housekeeping knocked twice this morning to clean the room while we were still sleeping. Housekeeping stood outside the door waiting for us to leave last night after we requested turn-down service. There is a cd player, but no ipod dock. Who uses cd's?, and the ones in the room were from 1990?!?!?! We did not even have a coffee maker in the room. When we checked out, we had to wait in a long line because there is no express checkout, as they actually use keys for the rooms instead of cards like every other hotel in the 21st century. Then the reception desk smartly did not ask us how our stay was because they probably knew that it wasn't to the caliber we were sold. We also could not fill-out the comment card in the room, because we couldn't find a pen anywhere in the room! Our last moment before finally leaving was waiting 15 minutes for our suitcase they had held for us.Please choose another of the dozens of hotels in Chicago with great service and great gold coast location - I love the Sofitel, or if you want budget in the area stay at the Whitehall. The Sutton place should never be on the same list as the Peninsula, Four Seasons, and Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: K C
Reviews.Content: Stayed with children (8 and 10) plus grandparents at Sutton Chicago for 3 nights and loved this hotel. Yes, parking is steep ($45 per night) and there is no pool. But I find the hotel to be excellent for our travel plans: (i) Location location location - River North area. Two blocks to the Oak Street beach - definitely an urban oasis not to be missed. About a 10-minute walk from the hotel. (ii) Great restaurants and bars within easy walking distance. Right across the street is a very good pancakes for breakfast. We also enjoyed Tavern on Rush, also right across the street - best pan seared Tuna ever. (iii) Depending on how fast you walk, John Hancock Observatory is easily within 10-minutes walk. This made it possible for us to go once in the morning (beating the crowd) and once at night to see the fireworks at Navy Pier. (iv) We got an excellent price from priceline, but the hotel treats all guests the same regardless of how the rooms were booked. We even got a complimentary bottle of wine and chocolate covered strawberries on our second day. A true delight. Our room on the 21st floor had really nice views to the north. (v) Priceline booking comes with a king bed. When I called ahead of time asking for double beds, I was told there was an up charge of $40 per room per night. However, when we checked in, we got one room with double beds for no extra charge. So if you can, wait until you get there. (vi) We are not shopping fanatics. If you are (and have lots of cash), the hotel is one block from all the luxury stores on Oak Street. (vii) There is additional charge for internet (wireless) - but it didn't work for us. We didn't find the wireless network. However, there is a business center with 3 computers. You can use it for free from 5am to midnight. Printing is $1 a page, but boarding passes are free, I believe.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay...”
Reviews.Author: Kevnic14
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel that we booked through Priceline and we were pleasantly surprised. Our room was very large, and we had a good view. The washroom was nice and we loved the shower and tub options. The service at the front desk was wonderful and we enjoyed the services of the concierge - their newsletter with different options was very helpful to us. They were wonderful at allowing us to keep our baggage locked away until it was time for us to catch our train. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jessiclees
Reviews.Content: We came to Chicago for our honeymoon and arrived at the hotel tired but excited. The welcome at the reception was amazing. They congratulated us on our wedding and then informed us that we had been upgraded to a lake view room - WOW what a room. The views were amazing. The bed was comfy and the towels fluffy. They had even left us a card congratulating us on our marriage. I think it is little touches like this that make you remember. All the staff (in fact all Chicagoans) were lovely. The location is also great, we were able to walk everywhere, but when we went further afield, the underground was close too. We didn't have breakfast included, but the pancake shop opposite is great. Also on the corner of East Cedar Street and North State street there in an amazing breakfast place, I highly recommend going there. It is called the Corner Bakery Cafe. A really fabulous hotel, it was a great way to start our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: BoomerTravel
Reviews.Content: The Sutton is a wonderful hotel in the best location. All around the hotel are restaurants to eat and places to get a drink at night. Next door is Tavern on Rush which is the very best. Great night life, good people whatching. Dinner upstairs is very good and drinks and appetizers downtstairs are even better. Mortons, Original Pancake House and Hugo Frogs are next door and are all very good. Amazing amount of people who show each night to this area to eat and have fun. Michigan Ave. is a very short walk away from the hotel. My wife spent each day shopping and still didn't see it all. Hotel is large but with a small lobby with free apples. Our room was a corner unit on the 19th which had an amazing view of all of the north side of the city and the lake. Very comfortable king bed, walk in shower with a separte tub, large flat screen tv quiet at night, quick elevators and everything was very clean. Funny thing, they give you an actual key for your room, not the card we see most often. Staff was extremly nice.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Customer Service ever”
Reviews.Author: ReviewerLA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location , but the service is the worst I 'vs encountered. Nicole and Alex are the front desk reception were rude, unprofessional, and unaccomodating, Nicole picked up the phone while I was trying to speak to her and Alex wouldN't let me finish my sentence. This hotel definitely lacks in customer service an etiquette.

Reviews.Title: “NICE PLACE / GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: LIGINI
Reviews.Content: Sutton Place appears to be fairly new, with large, clean rooms. (Our bathroom had a large tub and separate shower stall.) Staff very friendly. Located at intersection of Rush Street and Bellevue Place - a half dozen or more great restaurants and bars within sight of the hotel (i.e. Gibson's Steakhouse, Lux Bar.) Streets are busy at night with people, but didn't hear a thing inside the room. Just down the block from Lake Michigan, a few blocks to the Red Line subway. Not cheap, but no place was in Chicago - think it was a good value for the money. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Atmosphere is so professional and so welcoming at the same time!!!”
Reviews.Author: penelopejoan
Reviews.Content: "Luxury Boutique," "Personalized Service" and "Spectacular Setting" are not just words in the hotel's promotional materials, they are a "Lifestyle" at The Sutton Place. They say it is impossible to make a second 'First Impression' and the Staff at the front door, the concierge desk and the front desk are genius at accomplishing this. Their warmth and hospitality made us feel like we were truly wanted the first time and every time we walked in and out the front door during our stay. David Sowell, General Manager, and Jennifer Pfeiffer, Director of Sales and Marketing, were so gracious to meet. Our stay was more than marvelous. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “The Sutton King”
Reviews.Author: violetta77777
Reviews.Content: Huge room w/ king bed, work desk, chair with ottoman. Large, well equipped bathroom - glass shower stall & tub, chair, bathrobe. Coffee (quite good) in the lobby only till 9:30AM. No lobby - just step outside and you will find everything you need . A few nice and famous restaurants and small park with fountain right across the street. Boutiques are one block away. Upscale houses, Lake beaches - 2 blocks. 7-11 and Supermarket within 2 blocks. Get in touch with www.chicagogreeter.com at least 7 day in advance - they (Chicago Office of Tourism) will arrange a volunteer guide and a free one full day metro/bus pass (buses are more convenient as you don't have to go underground) . Treat your free guide well (not that you have to) and you will see a lot. The Historic buildings are beautiful not only from outside - go inside as well!!! Go to John Hancock bldg 94-95th floor for a drink or lunch and enjoy beautiful views of the city and lake.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: jfrocks
Reviews.Content: I had to write this review as I have been traveling to Chicago for a few years now and have stayed at the Sutton Place Hotel for a good portion of those 2 years. The service is absolutely outstanding, the rooms are quiet and clean, and the location is the best part of all as it is close to night life, the best restaurants, and of course superb shopping. I cannot say enough about this hotel as it offers more than just a place to sleep it is a great experience everytime I go and always leaves me in a good mood when I leave. You will not go wrong with the Sutton Place anytime!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious; yet affordable”
Reviews.Author: lefty713
Reviews.Content: At the end of a lovely tree-lined street, where Rush and State Streets meet, sits the Sutton Place Hotel. A small lobby may fool you into thinking the rooms might be tiny. Do not be fooled. The rooms are spacious, well-appointed and very comfortable. The bed is terrific, with a nice assortment of pillows. The deep tub is tremendous, as are the bath products. The neighborhood is quite fun, the people watching is spectacular. I would recommend this hotel, I got lucky and got the $130 special. It was certainly worth much more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Good, But Not Better Than Average”
Reviews.Author: annie_malone
Reviews.Content: Sutton Placeâ€™s best aspect is its location, and helpful, courteous staff. Otherwise, I felt this hotel was average for its price range in a good Chicago neighborhood. Demeritsâ€¦.what are they thinking, requiring guests to queue up for coffee in the lobby in the morning? And, something I found completely puzzling, no PBS on the television menu in room. They might consider that some of their guests may want some intelligent access to the outside world while away from home. Be aware that there are no DSL connections in rooms, only wireless...plus daily internet charge that runs from noon to noon, with no exceptions. I think this is all for the convenience of the hotel, not the convenience of guests. Also, photos on the website are misleading. The site features suite rooms with great window viewsâ€¦..regular rooms are fine, but they are nowhere near so spacious, just regular hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LPJernigan
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine was getting married and had given out a list of hotels for guests to choose from for their stay. After calling the hotels that I thought would be the most resonable and finding out I was wrong, I decided to try the Sutton Place. It turned out had better rates than all the others and it was in a great location. The hotel staff was very friendly and the guys out front always helped us hail a taxi. The rooms were clean and comfortable. They could use some updating though. The carpet, the wallpaper, and the bathroom fixures need to be replaced. Not dirty or dingy, just outdated. The bed was very comfortable and the room stayed nice and cool. We stayed on the side facing the Luxe Bar and heard no noise at all. The location was great! We were right across from Tavern on Rush and the Original Pancake house, so breakfast or lunch depending on when we ventured out was right at our doorstep! Gibson's steakhouse was also across the street. The walk to Michigan Ave was beautiful and very doable. We walked from our hotel to Navy Pier as well! My husband and I truly enjoyed our stay at the Sutton Place and in Chicago! What a great city and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, nice staff, but...”
Reviews.Author: apjb2010
Reviews.Content: We generally enjoyed our stay here in a spacious 18th floor corner room. The staff were very friendly and welcoming, but the downside was the very limited size lobby with no real space to sit and relax. The adjacent bar was extremely noisy and served us a very greasy and unappealing pizza one night. Finally we were very annoyed to find a charge of 7 dollars for a small bottle of water which was left at our bedside. They did point out that it had a notice around the neck stating the cost - but really, how cheap can you get to do this to someone spending a couple of thousand dollars! It was obvious from the receptionist that many guests were caught out by this brainless idea, probably from some kid straight out of business school!

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic City......a Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TorontoLady46
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 2 daughters and I spent 3 days in Chicago and really had a great time. The hotel is well situated, within walking distance of the Magnificent Mile, with great shopping and excellent and numerous restaurants. The staff at the hotel were excellent, friendly and very efficient...from the doorman to the front desk to the cleaning staff. Particularly helpful were the people at the Concierge Desk. The room at the hotel was large with a king size bed. It was spotlessly clean and had everything that you needed. The added touch of a cup of coffee in the lobby in the morning was well appreciated. All in all, we have nothing but positive things to say about the hotel and we certainly would stay again when we are in Chicago (hopefully soon).

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: derbygirl7881
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated on residential Bellevue Ave in the Gold Coast neighborhood of Chicago. It was amazing to feel like you were walking down a street that should be in the movies. The original Mortons steakhouse as well as Gibsons steakhouse are literally right across the street from the hotel. As a side note the "hotel bar" became very crowded on a Friday night so my friends and I were forced to try the "LUX Bar" across the street. BIG mistake. It was exptemely expensive and the clientel were decidedly snooty. I would venture further down Rush street next time for a more reasonable/relaxed bar atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with super location and professional staff!”
Reviews.Author: nashvillefoodie
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for three nights in April at the recommendation of a good friend who knows the city. We had a fabulous time in Chicago and a fabulous stay at The Sutton Place. Yummie champagne, cheese plate and chocolate covered strawberries as soon as we entered the room (pre-arranged by friends). Bed was so comfortable we were checking the mattress tag to shop beds when we got home. Super views (from room 1808). Absolutely no noise. Perfect location. Great selection of restaurants all around and a reasonable walk to tons of shopping along Magnificent Mile (if that's your thing). Also, access to the Red Line train is a five-minute walk from the hotel. We took it to Boystown as well as a nearby stop for Crate and Barrell and CB2.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen Wedding Ring & Not Even a Discount Off Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kreechy
Reviews.Content: Here is the deal I was super excited and happy with the overall staff and really loved the location of the hotel. The cleanliness of the hotel was great but maybe too good! All I know is I walked in with my wedding ring and checked out without one. When I went to report it stolen after searching every piece of luggage, rummaging, the entire room and its furniture and looking thru every picture to see when it was last on me and in my possession it all lead to the same conclusion. My ring was stolen. If they hadn't said that my other two girlfriends stole my ring, charged me an extra six dollars bottle of water consumed and taken off the one bottle of water drank, then maybe just maybe I would considered staying here again. Maybe if when I reported it stolen someone would have been gracious enough to follow thru with some sort of compensation like I don't know a a free night's stay or two- but nothing. Instead just shushed and asked to file a report with the police department.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem in the Best Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: kfortunato
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the Sutton Place Hotel on East Belleveu Place on the Gold Coast in Chicago. I stay there at least once a quarter for business travel and I cannot imagine staying anywhere else. It is small, quiet, has wonderful staff and service and is located among great restaurants and shops - perfect after a long day of work. I am welcomed back by staff who knows me and who make me look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: janking6
Reviews.Content: We never got a honeymoon. And we never have time alone. So the opportunity to get away for even one night meant we wanted some place special. We found it at this hotel. The staff was fantastic. The location was exciting. And the room (the grand penthouse suite) provided a very romantic setting for a romantic night. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Small Extras”
Reviews.Author: orr333
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sutton Place for a couple of nights on a business trip. I rarely venture outside of the Hilton chain as I am a Diamond member in that group. The Sutton is much like a Hilton in bed quality. The fabric did not smell like a hotel though....it was like mom washed it and was soothing. The bathroom had a tub with a separate glass shower. Under the bathroom counter was a stool which the ladies in our group enjoyed to apply their makeup. The room also has a DVD player with a small stereo including a few random CDs to listen to (even if I do not care for Lena Horne!). The bell staff and concierge are very good, always opening doors and making you feel very welcome. I found the attached "Whiskey" to be an OK if a little overpriced for drinks. Music was too loud. Breakfast in the Whiskey was pretty good but service was horrible. In the immediate vicinity on Rush Street is Gibson's Steakhouse and the Frog Bar as well as many other places to eat and drink. I would stay here again without a question especially if my Hilton was already booked up!

Reviews.Title: “Old favourite”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaC2
Reviews.Content: My family have stayed at this hotel about once a year for the last eight years. We love it. It's perfectly located, luxurious without being stuffy, clean and quiet. Only complaint would be the charge of $10 a day for internet. Otherwise don't think twice... book today.

Reviews.Title: “Very good business or leisure hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spenser
Reviews.Content: Very nice upscale hotel.The location could not be better- right off Rush Street and convenient cab ride to the Loop. Room was very well appointed with a great view of the lake. the staff was most helpful. Easy walk to a host of restaurants and shopping. What else could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel good place for a solo lady traveler”
Reviews.Author: navawritz
Reviews.Content: it was my 2nd trip to the hotel and i was very lucky as the stuff seemed to be hotelier school traniers and they all very good you know the new they try harder smiling i was happy with my room i had great city view overlooking the resturant next door which had outdoor seatting in june in chicago lovely~ will be back hotwire had great prices but the same for expedia~

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Located”
Reviews.Author: kjb176
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located to Chicago shopping and restaurants (Carmine's restaurant is across the street; terrific food and massive desserts). Hotel check-in went smoothly. This high-rise hotel has two elevators and one elevator was not working, therefore wait times getting an elevator were longer than usual in the lobby and from your floor level. The rooms were fine, although certainly indicating signs of wear and tear. Check-out was cumbersome as their computers were down and the staff was shuffling mounds of paper around the front desk to reconcile check-out. The Whiskey Bar in the hotel lobby is worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: travelguy20
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews I have to wonder if we were staying at the same hotel. I have heard very positive things about this hotel both from associates and this website and am quite confused as my experience was nothing special. The hotel has a very small lobby that is dark in tone and not altogether welcoming. I didn't encounter any service issues, just felt as though the property itself did not compare to other 4 star hotels in the area. The bedroom was a decent size and looked to be recently re-decorated, but the bathroom was just awful. Despite reading on their website, and even in a brochure sitting in my room, that all bathrooms had a soaking tub and separate enclosed shower mine did not. It had a small tub with a shower head on the wall. The tub looked to be old and had been covered with some sort of vinyl covering that crinkled when you stepped on it. The black and white tile on the floors and walls reminded me more of a dorm bathroom than a 4 star hotel. Having stayed in many of the 4 star hotels downtown, I would say this is one of the worst. The "fitness center" is just an old hotel room that they have placed 4 or 5 cardio machines into with no other changes to decor. It was one of the worst I have seen. The location itself is good and there are a lot of opportunities for food close by, but the same would be true at the Sofitel or The Drake. Overall I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: Scenario11
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quite getaway in a perfect location, then this hotel is for you. The hotel is very peaceful and the rooms are very nice. I booked the hotel at a discounted rate and was not disappointed. The bed was very comfortable. The cd player in the room added a nice touch (I booked it as a romantic get away). Tavern on rush is across the street along with many other restaurant options. The Water Tower & Shopping are a couple of blocks away. I wish could have stayed longer. The downside: Parking is very expensive $45 a night...if you pay before check-in you can get it for $35 a night. Also, there was a minor discrepancy on my bill. I was charged for bar usage in the room. ( I specifically did not take the bar key at check-in because i knew I would not use it). They credited the charge back to my account with no hassle after I called them.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: glofish5
Reviews.Content: The Sutton Place Hotel in Chicago is extremely pleasant. The hotel has a great location near Michigan Avenue and restaurants, retail stores, grocery stores and most anything you would need. We went for a weekend in February and got a very good deal which included a wonderful continental breakfast. The room was great and we had a view of Rush Street. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The concierge provided a list of events in the city that was very well done. Free daily newspapers were a plus for my husband. You must take time to enjoy the oversize tub in the bathroom. It is very relaxing and the hotel provides bubbling mineral bath which enhances the experience. The hotel is a cut above and I heartily recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cjivers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in early Feb 2010 while attending a wedding. From check in to check out the service was efficient and friendly. The room was beautiful and the maid service was excellent. It's located in the Gold Coast of Chicago, the most expensive and exclusive area with excellent shops and restaurants. It's less than five minutes from Michegan Ave or the Oak Street Beach. I didn't spend much time in the Whiskey Bar as it drew a lot of young kids and was very loud. All in all, this was an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better in years before”
Reviews.Author: BringAHeater
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sutton Place for Valentine's Day. We've done this the last 3 years, and every other year was amazing. The location can't be beat and the suites are nice for the rates. We were disappointed by our stay this year. We arrived late (due to traffic) and the drop off area was backed up onto Rush. Even though we were late for our dinner reservations, we had to park the car in a lot about a block away. We had dinner reservations din the loop, which the conceriege said he would call to let them know we'd be 15 minutes late. He didn't. We had ordered champagne for the room, which wasn't in the room when we arrived. And the room smelled like the previous guest(s) had smoked. The prior years, the service was excellent. This year it was sub-standard. I think we'll try another Chicago hotel next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: FredKMadison_WI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sutton Place Hotel for three days over Christmas. Although the hotel was not "full", everyone who worked there was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were very nice, especially the Jr. suite, and the beds and linens were very comfortable. The location cannot be beat--walking distance to all of the "downtown" attractions and restaurants. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but no Four Star”
Reviews.Author: ZZChild
Reviews.Content: My stay was 11/27/09 â€“ 11/30/09 and I must say that your staff is one of the best I have encountered in my many travels. However I must say that I was disappointed in the hotel as a whole. The location is its biggest asset, but the room itself is not what I expected based on the pictures you have displayed on your website. The room was consistently hot no matter how low I adjusted the thermostat, the bathroom was a little outdated (based on whatâ€™s advertised on your website), and the cable TV had a distorted picture even after the Engineer tried to fix it. I had an issue with my billing on my room service and had to call several times to get it resolved (never received a call from front desk, they just slid an additional bill under my door) .Iâ€™m not trying to make comparisons, but I could have stayed in the Trump Tower for a couple hundred dollars more based on what I paid to stay at the property. They have a nice property, but to advertise it as a Four Star Hotel is misleading. I would have to compare it to a Springhill Suite or Holiday Inn Express just without a Concierge. This is not an attempt to bash the property, but to merely make one aware of how their website portrays an image that lacks just a bit of what is expected.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for a better place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 808Jen
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel+flight package on Priceline.com. We researched for weeks and finally settled on The Sutton. Everything about our stay there was wonderful. I called the night before to confirm our reservation and to see if we would be able to get an early check-in. The agent on the phone said she couldn't guarantee early check-in but she would put the request down. We arrived at the hotel at 7 a.m. and were thrilled we were allowed to get into our room at that time!! Every single staff member we encountered was wonderful! The room was spacious and very clean. The bathroom was nice, with a walk-in shower and large tub to soak in. There was a hair dryer, complimentary soaps, lotions, etc., iron, safe, minibar, dvd player and flat screen t.v.. Room service was excellent, eggs benedict and french toast was to-die-for! We also called the front desk asking if we could have use of their vacuum so we could space save our clothes in our luggage. The hotel accommodated our request. Our airport shuttle ended up coming early and leaving without us!! So, the doormen offered the service of the hotel driver. It was sure nice riding in a Suburban in style! We will, without a doubt, stay at The Sutton Place Hotel Chicago on our trip back next year. Thank you to all the staff that treated us wonderfully!

Reviews.Title: “Service & Location Could Not Be Better!!”
Reviews.Author: LaCerra
Reviews.Content: We had some friends stay there for a reunion. To say the least, we got well taken care of. The service from the front desk to the valet to the bellmen was impeccable. The location is perfect for a night on the town in Chicago's most exciring area. I would recommend staying there whether it be a getaway with the spouse or a group of friends ready to party.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended !!!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGuy1965
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Sutton Place Hotel was just wonderful. My room had a great view of many iconic Chicago establishment. The location was perfect! The room itself was very clean, tastefully decorated and had great amenities such as Wi-Fi, a flat screen TV, DVD player, etc. The staff was extremely helpful, even late into the evening. Parking was a breeze as they offer an overnight valet. While I stayed there myself, after my wife heard me raving about the hotel, she and I are planning a trip down in the summer. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Chicago for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, room huge”
Reviews.Author: Elvisiswithme
Reviews.Content: The Sutton Place is a fantastic hotel. The room was huge with a good view, lovely large bathroom. Unfortunately no tea or coffee making facilities in the room but this was available free in the lobby area but only in the mornings I think. The area was close to all the shopping you could want but the subway line was a good 10 minute walk away if you wanted to head downtown towards the loop area. The staff did not know much about getting buses or using public transport, this hotel is geared towards the business traveller, not the tourist. However, if you are quite capable of doing your own thing and finding out your own information then this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “"The Finest Chicago Hotel I have stayed at to date"”
Reviews.Author: rds30001
Reviews.Content: This past week I stayed at the Sutton Place Hotel in downtown Chicago. I was attending a medical conference and the location of the hotel, within walking distance of the "Miracle Mile", downtown and the Lakeshore made it a perfect location." I have stayed in many of Chicago's finest hotels, many of which are typically priced well above the level of the Sutton Place Hotel. I have never stayed in a finer hotel in Chicago. As a comparison, my medical conference was held in a "Five Star" hotel, five minutes walking distance from the Sutton Place. I was in several of the rooms at this "Five Star" hotel as a guest of fellow physicians. I in fact have stayed in this "Five Star" hotel several times in the past, yet without question the Sutton Place Hotel was finer, in my opinion, in all respects. The Sutton Place Hotel's price was one quarter of this "Five Star" hotel. I was placed on the Penthouse Suite of the Sutton Place, I had a perfect view, my room was spotless. Both room service and the attached restaurant / bar were excellent. The hotel offers a business center in which guests are able to use the internet for free, which allows me to leave my laptop at home. The valet parking rates, with hotel validation, are a very good deal. I would HIGHLY recommend any Chicago traveler, for business or pleasure to stay at the Sutton Place Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff EVER”
Reviews.Author: nyrookie
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a week and was extremely impressed by the staff, who made this probably our best hotel stay ever. By our second day there, the doormen greeted us BY NAME as we came and went and remembered little details about where we said we were going. The concierge was very friendly and super helpful, arranging nice tours and getting us awesome seats for a musical. The room was small, but the floor-to-ceiling windows made it feel much bigger than it was. We enjoyed the chocolate covered strawberries that were waiting for us when we got to the room. The separate tub (it was huge) and shower were nice, too. The restaurant had good food at suprisingly reasonable prices. The hotel location was fairly good; we were able to walk to some places, but mostly took cabs. Overall, though, it's the staff that made Sutton Place top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: koolyoung
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel. I was in Chicago for a conference and it was in a great location to the downtown area. Lots of shopping and great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “friendly welcoming staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: benbulben
Reviews.Content: my husband and I booked this hotel through priceline-named our own price and got a great deal(less than 1/2 price), we were worried that we might be treated differently from others who had paid full rate, but no, we really enjoyed our stay here. From check-in to check-out we were treated like we were special--we were upgraded to a lake view room with floor to ceiling windows on 2 walls, what a great view. we had room service on 1 night--food was perfect, service quick and professional--we were impressed, we were sorry we didn't have dessert as well as soup and main courses!!! but as portions were huge could not fit it in!! all staff were so helpful and polite,room was very clean, nicely decorated, and large. the business centre was useful to check emails, although there are only 2 monitors and I had to wait a while on one occasion as both were occupied. There is a charge for printing--not something we saw in any other hotel we stayed in on this trip--but if you want to print out boarding passes it's free so that's fine. the hotel is situated close to shopping with lots of nice restaurants nearby--we tried the pancake house for breakfast one morning---very good, busy and expect to wait for a table but enjoyable, the second morning we went to the corner bakery--great porridge(oatmeal) and tea!!, very good value. It's just a short stroll to lake mitchigan, or take the red line into downtown or further, overall this hotel is ideal and we would love to return there some day, the staff are fabulous

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LondonUna
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for the marathon and arrived at the hotel very tired after a long flight from London, only to be told that they did not have our reservation. The staff at the desk, although very pleasant were inexperienced in customer service. It was eventually sorted but we had to miss out on a dinner reservation and we were not even offered a complementary drink from the bar. This bad start aside, we could not fault the hotel. The rooms were spacious and very clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. The complementary tea and coffee that is served in the lobby every morning is a nice touch. The doormen were extremely pleasant and not atall pushy for tips. You could not find a better location in the whole of Chicago. You are a five minute walk from the shoreline, lovely beaches and very scenic and you are the same distance from the start of the magnificant mile. You are immediately opposite two fabulous restaurants, Hugo's Frog Bar and Gibsons Steakhouse, both pricey but worth it for the quality of the food. The hotel bar, The Wiskey has a great selection of cocktails and wines and the atmosphere is great with a mixed crowd of young and old alike, not atall stuffy. I would definately recommend this hotel and I will definately stay here again next time I am in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: cmckayboulder
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Sutton Place to watch some friends run the Chicago Marathon. It was excellent from beginning to end; super-helpful reception staff, beautiful room with great views, really comfortable beds, soaking tub, blazing hot shower and the place is also incredibly quiet. You can easily get around by walking or subway and the Pancake House across the street is cheap, cheerful and good food. Also check out the German tea shop down the street. All in all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, within walking distance to everything!”
Reviews.Author: sarahprny
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here when we had to travel to Chicago on business. We both agreed that we would absolutely stay there again. It was located in the heart of a great restaurant district. We shopped, ate and went sightseeing all without needing a car or taxi. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We had a lot of space!! I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, watch for hidden charges!”
Reviews.Author: jlbskc6
Reviews.Content: I left the hotel with a $211 bill and arived home with a $241 charge to my account. When I called the manager, he predictably sent me to the accounting department who was no longer working. I can't recommend a hotel that employs these tatics.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Monroe414
Reviews.Content: I resided at The Sutton Place Hotel while visiting Chicago for a 10 day vacation. The hotel felt like home away from home. The bed was very comfortable and I soaked in the big jacuzzi tub every chance I got. I had the corner room which overlooked the Pancake House and had views of Oak Beach and the Lake. I am a late riser and staff were understanding, they did not to bother me to clean the room. Luckily they have day and night cleaners, sometimes I never left the room until late afternoon, those were my lazy days. The room felt like an apartment and the stereo with speakers was an added amenity. When I read a book I would put the stereo on for background music and with the sunlight gleaming into my room it was very relaxing. The only disturbance I experienced was the slamming of doors by the housekeeping staff. I would suggest they use door stops when constantly entering and exiting the rooms they are servicing. Apart from that and the Friday night happy hour at the Tavern on The Rush, the room was reasonably quiet. Being a solo traveler I found the area around the hotel very safe and I felt comfortable walking about at night. Since there are so many popular restaurants in the area, it can get very busy with traffic and people in the evenings which is great for people watching. The beach and Mag Mile is about 2 or 3 blocks away, a 10 minute walk at best which is very convenient for lakefront exercise or shopping. I enjoyed the double decker bus and trolley tours, which I did twice, after all you can't see the best of Chicago in one day! The Lakefront Bike and Roll tour and the evening Architectural Boat cruise were my favorites, both tours are so very interesting and informative. Most people I encountered were very friendly and helpful, I met a lot of nice people, cab drivers, sales staff in the shops on State Street, the tour guides and other solo travelers on the various tours. Although I did visit Chicato for 10 days, there is still so much I did not experience, therefore I shall return. A big thank you to the Chicago forum, their advice in the pre planning stage of this trip was priceless. Sutton Place advertised a 48 hour promotion sale, therefore I booked a corner room for $110.00 per night, If you are planning a trip to Chicago, check the hotel website for promotions daily, I got lucky and have no regrets!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CherieL_9
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Sutton Place. The beds were excellent as were the pillows It is close to everything. Across the road is the Original Pancake Parlor. You could not find a better place for breakfast. The only downside to the hotel was the cost of parking, but apparently that is pretty much standard in Chicago. We parked our rental car at the Airport for $8 a day and caught the train into town and that was very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Americanadventurerz
Reviews.Content: The only bad thing about this hotel is there is no free parking and the parking they do offer is $45 for 1 day! The front desk were very polite and helpful while checking you in; the bellmen and consierge were very helpful in sorting out directions and helping in finding attractions. The room was great with a very comfortable bed; the best bit was the tub, by far. The bathroom was decked out with a stool to sit on while putting on makeup, and also a phone. The location was ideal, as there were fantastic restaraunts within the vacinity and it was located next to the magnificent mile. We were also easily able to walk to navy pier.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: CatManDude
Reviews.Content: From the moment of arrival to the time of departure every service we recieved was excellent. Everyone on the entire staff was professional and helpful. Our room was excellent, very clean and comfortable with an exciting view of the city. What do we say about LOCATION - well location is everything and this Hotel has it. We could easily walk or cab to nice restaurants, Miracle Mile shopping or Chicago River Bike Tours and Boat Tours. It would be difficult to pick what we liked best about our stay but if pressed I have to say the Dining in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “First class service from the moment you reach the property...”
Reviews.Author: cposso1022
Reviews.Content: Judging by the way we were greeted you would think they gave us the Penthouse Suite. That's because they treat every guest as if they're in the Penthouse. Our room was great; very clean, and decorated nicely. The service was excellent from beginning to end. Sandro who manages the front desk was fantastic! He handled an extra night stay with professionalism and a warm smile. When we left, he told us to visit again or just stop by to say hello. Nice touch... It felt like the staff at Sutton Place Hotel really care about your experience. Did I mention location? The hotel is a prime property in the heart of the glitzy fine dining and people watching area known as Rush Street. You are steps away from Tavern on Rush, Hugo's, Gibson's, LuxBar, Carmines, Morton's, and Whiskey Bar. If you walk two blocks east, you're at the lakefront. If you walk two blocks north, you're in the busiest stretch of nightlife in Chicago (Division Street). I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location BUT NOT a 4star hotel”
Reviews.Author: shonerod
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location, very comfortable beds, excellent price $95 nightly, within walking distance to everything, very quiet area to be near Rush street CONS: small hotel room, small lobby, dull room colors, actually rooms need Remodeling, not impress with bathroom rooms, This is definitely not a 4 star hotel; if it were listed as a 3 or maybe a 3 half star expectation would have been different.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Tio-Ned
Reviews.Content: Rooms are comfortable, beautiful and quiet and the staff helpful, location (smack on Rush Street across from Gibsons) is excellent. CD player, minibar and dressing gown are nice touches. I got this on a $99/night special, otherwise I rarely stay at a place this nice! Only critique I have is the wi-fi internet ought to be free of charge in a place like this, and the TV/cable needs upgrading. It's the 21st century, folks, if your hotel is in the priciest neighborhood in Chicago, you ought to have satellite HDTV not basic cable and standard TV!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Excellent service”
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Sutton Place Hotel for three nights with my teenage children. We were very pleased overall with the service. The bed was comfy, the roll-away bed adequate, other furnishings and room features, such as the beautiful bathroom (glass shower stall and separate extra deep bath tub), and CD/Stereo were nice. We enjoyed the chocolates on the bed when our room was cleaned. The mostly bare white and light gray wide stripe wallpaper colors and medium gray carpet colors in the room were a bit muted for our taste. The location was terrific at the corner of Rush Street and Bellevue across from Gibson Steak House, Carmine's Restaurant, LuxBar and other restaurants and bars. Pancake House across the street serves a scrumptious strawberry crepe. Easy public transportation everywhere. We used public transportation exclusively and it worked out very well with the 3-day CTA pass. State Street bus stop one small block away. Red line subway just a few blocks walk away. Very convenient. An easy walk to Oak Street beach and Lake Michigan. Complimentary coffee and fruit in lobby in morning. Withing a few blocks of Magnificent Mile shopping as well. Very quiet hotel. Did not hear anyone in halls or neighboring rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: Vic888
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights from 3-5th August and booked a double queen room via Expedia. Check in was fast, bellman friendly and we got a great room on 19th floor which was spacious, clean and well provided for in terms of towels, amenities and furniture. There is no cafe in house ( just the whisky bar & grill) so food only available via room service; however the location is so great for shopping and eating that everything is literally on your doorstep. We loved it here and would definately recommend to anyone coming to Chicago for 1st time. Highly recommend Gibsons for steaks, Pancake house for breakfast/lunch, and Pizano's for chicago style pizza ........ all within short walk from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-terrible service”
Reviews.Author: kandiceavery
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at Sutton Place hotel for the past 3 nights. The location is great for shopping and restaurants. The room was nice and the beds were very comfortable. The front door men and then maid service were courteous. PROBLEM: They charge for internet. They charged us for room service that we never received and could not offer any resolution to this problem. would not allow a late check out. I would not stay here again. The front staff was TERRIBLE. Expensive area to be in.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location”
Reviews.Author: NolaGal_2
Reviews.Content: Middle of the "happening" Gold Coast corner of Maple, Rush and Bellevue, steps away from Magnificent Mile, it's ideal for those that don't want the noisy hubbub of being directly ON the MM but still in a perfect spot. No breakfast included but you're steps away from LuxBar or Original Pancake House. Had a fantastic meal of homemade pastas and bolognese sauce at Marlo on Maple (ask for Jeremy for your waiter). Got the Lake corner room for a beautiful view. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest for family with grade school children”
Reviews.Author: Ilovebostons
Reviews.Content: Okay, we got a great rate on priceline name your price, so I can't complain, but I will anyway, the room on priceline does not guarantee you 2 doubles or 1 king, so when we checked in at 5:30 pm they stated only 1 king room available, so we had to pay extra 25 per night for one rollaway, all that would fit. The front desk claimed I booked 1 king, but according to priceline I did not book any type of bedding, I guess my fault anyway by default I could have called. So DH got the kicks to the head whilst I slept on the extra rollaway for 2 nights. Also, missed the coffee maker in room, and had to wait until 0700 to get coffee on sat morning. we are early risers and also were on EST so it did not seem so early to us. We were a 25 dollar cab ride from Science and Industry. Only could walk to American Girl Place and Hershey Chicago. Otherwise needed cabs. Nothing else going on here, no nice lobby, no pool, only adult type restaurant named "Whisky" like I would take my kids there! Next time will stay at the Embassy Suites, where we usually stay. Children did not like TV options, either. Maybe this is fine for couples, business travelers, but not a place for families aiming for the museums on the other side of the Loop. Be warned, moms!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: DALDEI
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the reviews I settled on the Sutton Place and am very glad I did. I was worried it would not be in the ideal location for Touristing but I was wrong. Chicago is so big you cant be in the ideal location for everything ! Its walking distance from Mag Mile and the Hancock building, and across the street from some of the best chicago restraunts and nightlife. The hotel is clean and efficient although a bit pricy. No in-room coffee ($15 from room service), and no on-floor ice machines (but free from room service). Internet costs $10 etc ... but its to be expected from a high end hotel. The Beds are AWESOME. Very comfortable and clean. I "splurged" on a Jr Suite which was very nice. Stayed on the 11th floor which is not as high up as I wanted but the view was still excellent. Very nice staff and decent conceriege although they had a few mistakes but mostly my fault for not asking the right questions. I was able to call them from downtown and ask for a reservation for Gibsons and they got it for me no problem while I was on the line. I'd definitely stay again and/or suggest to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoCatwoman
Reviews.Content: Great location on N. Rush - lots of cafes, bars, restuarants right outside. Hotel lovely, staff polite and a great rate on travel-ticker - $99. Bed extremely comfortable. Parking was $48 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “My Birthday Trip”
Reviews.Author: LizChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: I loved having everything close it felt great enjoying the weather and being able to walk to beach, Michigan Avenue!! :) The hotel was great decision to celebrate my birthday at!! Have to do it again!!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal!!”
Reviews.Author: Beardownchicagobears
Reviews.Content: What an amazing Hotel! I stayed there with my wife before we left for our Honeymoon and we had a great time. The service was great (from the Bell Captain, to the Front Desk, to the Housekeeping Staff....everyone was very friendly) and our Suite was the best. We went to dinner at Gibsons Steakhouse, which is right across the street, and walked around the neighborhood to take it all in afterwards. The location of this hotel is ideal! Looking forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and spacious rooms!”
Reviews.Author: jayembee12
Reviews.Content: Great spot to stay for a fun weekend in Chicago! It had been awhile since I last visited the city, and Sutton Place is right in the heart of it! It's tucked between Rush St. and Michigan Ave., not far from the John Hancock Center. There were lots of cool restaurants nearby, great shopping on Michigan Ave., and cool bars for any style within easy walking distance. Our room was fantastic! We stayed in a junior suite, which was a corner room with large windows that made for expansive views of the city. That way even when we slept in or got back early, we still felt like we were in the middle of it all. Not too noisy, though, so I had no trouble sleeping. Staff is very curteous and attentive, and valet parking was very convenient. We didn't spend anytime in the restaurant or bar at the hotel (I thought the breakfast was a little pricey, especially since there are so many cute restaurants in the area), but I did take advantage of the late-night room service. The price was very reasonable given everything the hotel offered and the phenomenal location. I would certainly come back!

Reviews.Title: “Always stay at Sutton Place”
Reviews.Author: Gunzee
Reviews.Content: We will be staying at the Sutton Place for the tird straight year this year during our visit to Chicago. Top notch hotel, great rooms, good service. You could spend less, but it is close to the beach, surrounded by good restaurants, and is in a very quaint and relaxing area of the city. We could stay anywhere, but we stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Three star hotel at a four star prices in a five star location.”
Reviews.Author: Taniquan
Reviews.Content: I am staying in this hotel now and have been here for three days so far. The best thing about this hotel and the only reason I would recommend it and come back is its location. It is in the heart of the Rush Street scene and a short walk from everyting else including the Magnificent Mile and the Art Institute. Everything is right outside the front door-numerous great restaurants, shopping i.e. Barneys New York and the shops of Oak Street. There is a small park across the street which on a nice day appears to be the center of activities in the neighborhood. But as for the hotel itself, I am sitting in my hotel room now looking around it is hard to tell the difference between this room and one in a Holiday Inn. The hotel does not have a pool and the lobby is very small. There is no outdoor patio or seating area as part of the hotel. So I cannot see what would qualify this hotelâ€™s facilities as 4 star. Maybe 3 stars plus but no more. Plus one factor which really disturbs me is having to pay an additional $9.99 a day for in room wifi after paying $200 night for a hotel room. If you too are bothered by paying this go to the park I mentioned or the huge Starbucks next to Barneys of New York for free wifi. So as I said I would recommend this hotel and stay here again only if I wanted to stay in this neighborhood and could get a good price on the room. But if I could get the Sofitel which is only 2 blocks away on Rush Street at the same price, I would prefer to go there for a true 4 star experience. As for a great eating experience you cannot go wrong with any of the outdoor restaurants across the street from the hotel. You will see that they are all packed (as in 1 hour 45 minute wait for seating) every night and for good reason. One thing that I found spectacular was the carrot cake desert at Gibsonâ€™s Steak House. It is the largest portion of a cake I have ever seen-I bet it weighed 4 pounds. If you love carrot cake, this will be a treat. And if you cannot eat it all they have a Large box to take the rest home.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: Luvtravel
Reviews.Content: The Sutton Place is a boutique hotel, with an extremely small lobby, practically, non-existent; however, the staff are friendly, helpful & accommodating. The hotel is surrounded by many nice restaurants, stores, and nightspots. It really is in a great location. We spent 2 nights in May'09 in a junior suite. It was modernly decorated, with nice plush bathrobes/slippers, but the room had much less amenities than I expected a Junior suite to have. It was comfortable, very clean, but not impressive. My suite was on the 17th floor and the views of Chicago were fantastic from my room. We had a very pleasant stay; and the Pancake House restaurant directly in front of the hotel serves delicious breakfast. I would definitely stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: Hummingbird112
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this great little hotel this past week-end June 5th to the 7th, and if we get back to Chicago I would only want to stay at Sutton Place. The location was fine for us, in a trendy area only 2 or 3 blocks to great shopping on the Magnifient Mile. Also a plus in the location is all the wonderful restaurants only steps away, we ate at The LUX bar, Travern on Rush, and Hugo the Frogs Bar. Our walk to the Navy Pier only took us 30 mins. Other than that we easily found taxis right in front our the Sutton when ever we needed. Now for the hotel itself, the lobby is fairly small, but our room (1405) was huge, along with the bath that had a separate shower stall from the tub. Both were extremely clean with great water pressure. I did enjoy using the complimentary bath robe. Only negative for the bathroom was no magnifying mirror. Our bed was king size and very comfortable. One of the best things about this place is the staff, all were helpful, competent, and friendly especially the concierge Cheryl Rule, she did a fantastic job for us more than once.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: vanb32
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel several times. Not only is it centrally located, its very quiet despite being in a very busy and active neighborhood. The staff is excellent, the place is always clean and fresh, the decor is amazingly soothing and the view of downtown and/or the lake just breathtaking! The last time we stayed at the hotel, it was to host a birthday sleepover for our son and his friends. The kids LOVED the penthouse we got, as the view of the lake was incredible, the lower level was spacious and kid friendly, with a big screen television and surround sound, which was perfect for their movie watching adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Sutton Place....EXCELLENT VISIT”
Reviews.Author: JandDfromIdaho
Reviews.Content: Wow...the hotel, view and location was fabulous! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, near Mag Mile...Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: luluva
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about this hotel at first, since I'm use to staying right on Mag Mile and since I got such a good rate on Priceline. I'm happy to say that I was proven wrong! This hotel was beautiful and the staff were nice and accommodating. The location was great! We were in the Gold Coast area which is very close to Mag Mile. However, there was a more neighborhood feel. We went to the breakfast place across the street and a place called Tempos a few blocks away. Both places were great! It's a good thing that we are early risers, because there was a line for breakfast every day when we were finished! We went to Tavern on Rush, also across the street, for lunch. Great place to people watch! The El station is only a few blocks away, so we could easily get to Wrigley. (Go cubs!) This was also a beautiful area to walk around and there was LOTS of shopping! I will definitely stay here again on my next Chicago trip!

Reviews.Title: “Class Act!”
Reviews.Author: jjoycee
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at The Sutton Place Hotel and had such a pleasant and comfortable stay, we added another night! This was our 3 time staying at this hotel and we were hoping that it would be as good as it was in the past since our last trip was 4 years ago - and the hotel was just a good as we remembered. The Sutton Place is located in a wonderful location on Rush Street which is right in the heart of elegant shops, clubs and great restaurants with (weather allowing) outdoor cafes with happy Chicagoans enjoying the infrequent sunshine. The outdoor cafes reminded me of Paris. Our room was, as in the past 3 stays, perfect! We had a city view but for a little more money you can have a lake Michigan view, we opted for the gorgeous city lights. Room size was just right and the bed and linens top quality luxury. The best are the fabulous bathrooms - large and perfect for two. What a pleasure to be able to soak in the large soaking tub while my husband showered at the same time. Sure is convenient when you are rushing to meet friends for dinner. The staff was friendly, the maid service was on time and very efficient. There is a bar and restaurant on the ground level, bar was jumping and so we stopped in every night before resting for our evening on the town. Right across the street is a pancake house with wonderful breakfasts (long lines on weekends) and a fun, lively bar and restaurant called "The Lux Bar." The food was delicious and reasonable and we later found out that "The Lux Bar" is owned by "Gibson's" which is a high end, expensive steak house, so no wonder the food and drinks were so great! We liked it so much, we went back a second time and the manager bought us our drinks for appreciation - that was very nice. I loved Chicago, it rained most of the time but it did not spoil our trip because we stayed at The Sutton Place which is walking and cab distance to everything in the city! The Sutton Place is not a large hotel and that is it's charm. It has that personal touch you only get from a smaller hotel , where the staff recognizes you and treats you like they are really happy that you are staying there. I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: MalynKiggs
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Chicago for Memorial Day weekend. I had found a great deal on Expedia ($109/night for a king room), and upon checking in, we were informed that we had received a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite. The suite was a large corner room that was clean, spacious, and modern. We had an excellent view of the city and were in a part of town with a wide variety of restaurants and shops and a few blocks from Michigan Ave. The staff were all very friendly from the minute I called to let them know we would be a late arrival to our checkout three days later. We were extremely pleased with the whole experience and would return again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Tamss97
Reviews.Content: I took my husband for his 40th birthday and another couple joined us. The staff was friendly and courteous. The door men were all wonderful and right there whenever you needed. The rooms are clean and every night there was a note on our bed advising as to what the weather would be like for the next day. Avoid ordering coffee by room service, it was $15 US for 4 small cups. There is complementary coffee in the lobby at about 7:30 a.m. Otherwise walk one block to the Corner Bakery Cafe, which also has a great light breakfast at reasonable prices. Gibson's across the street is a nice place for lunch and you're just 2 blocks from the Magnificent Mile shopping! Otherwise cabs are at your beck and call to take you anywhere; however, you may not like their driving! Very fast paced city and definitely a must to visit!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Who knows what?”
Reviews.Author: lalaschu
Reviews.Content: When I stopped by the desk to ask the black lady about buying a bus pass and printing a boarding pass, she directed me to the currency exchange for the buss pass and told me to go to the business center for the boarding pass. The keynotes say that the hotel sells bus passes and prints out boarding passes; why couldn't I have my services performed right then and there? The Russian or Czech lady at the front desk, was using a very nasty tone with another gentlmen at the desk; I immediately stopped and turned around. I walked the 4-5 blocks to get my buspass, just to find out that she gave me the wrong train information. What a big disappointment. The 2 days that I stayed there, the different operators were the ones that directed me to the right places..thanks Missy and Shawnna.

Reviews.Title: “Best location!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTellitall
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, with the best location in the city! They have an exc ellent staff, that is super nice, and was responsive to all of our needs. We were first assigned a smoking room, but when we asked to change, they brought new keys up to us, and walked us to another room! It was a corner room, with lake views, and very spacious. This hotel has a clean, modern look. It's not as fancy as the Four Seasons, but it is everything you need to feel like you are visiting Chicago with class;-) The Hotel is near all the best shopping, lots of wonderful restaurants, and great late night spots. The Whiskey bar is in the Hotel, and is a great spot to have a drink and watch the people on the street pass by. Doublin's is just across the way, and serves food until 4am! Jilly's has a great piano bar with 'Rat Pack' renditions until about 2am. It's a must stop and have at least 1 drink, if not a bottle of champagne. Prices were very reasonable. The Staff at the Hotel gets my biggest kudos! They are well trained in customer service, and made my stay feel special. Keep up the good work, Sutton Place!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in the City!”
Reviews.Author: kathy8929
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large beautiful contemporary decor, great bathrooms! I love the shower and of course the robes are a great touch! The best part is we were just steps away from the best shopping, dining and great jazz! We'll definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “The Sutton Place Hotel in Chicago is in the best location and offers the friendliest service making it a pleasure trip.”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoKittyII
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Sutton Place Hotel was fabulous. From the first minute I arrived, every staff member not only offered polite, professional service but genuinely seemed love their jobs. This is a pet friendly hotel in the heart of the Gold Coast. The location is great as it is located next to great dining and shopping. My room had an awesome view, it was clean and had great amenities. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Chicago - Sutton Place”
Reviews.Author: T&L
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many hotels in downtown Chicago, and the Sutton Place is my absolutely favorite...hands down. My husband and I just returned from our 4th trip to the Sutton Place, and all four trips have been wonderful! The location is great, the rooms are fabulous, but what makes this hotel top-notch is the staff. Gary, the head doorman, makes you feel like you are the one and only guest staying in the hotel. He is FANTASTIC!! You are just a couple blocks from Michigan Avenue and Water Tower, there are several great restaurants nearby (you must try Gibson's Steakhouse if you are looking for a place to eat....but plan ahead....you will definitely need a reservation on a weekend). Treat yourself to a stay at the Sutton Place. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for Chicago business trip”
Reviews.Author: coronella
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights there - Room was much better than average. Clean, quite (19th floor). Check in / Check out was smooth as can be. Good internet connection. $10 cab ride to Sears Tower. $50 ride to Airport. Lots of places to eat and shop within walking distance including groceries and pharmacies.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: cbolton73
Reviews.Content: The Sutton Place hotel was absolutely perfect! Our room on the 22nd floor gave us plenty of space, and was spotless. The view was spectacular, and the balcony was a great place to see the cityscape (if not a little chilly in February). The bed was extremely comfortable; better than any other hotel bed I have slept in. Service in the hotel was amazing. It never took more than 2 minutes to get a bucket of ice from room service. Mark, the concierge, perfectly set-up chocolate covered strawberries and champagne for Valentine's day. They were in the room when we arrived. Louis, and Cheryl drove me to my seminar every morning in the hotel Cadillac, which was extremely nice and, clearly well maintained. Louis was always fun in the morning. He told hilarious stories during the morning rides. Definitely, a real character. The location is tremendous. In the Gold Coast area of Chicago, the Sutton Place is located a few blocks from the Magnificent Mile. Also, the best restaurants and bars are no more that a couple of blocks from the hotel, with most (including Hugo's Frog Bar, and Gibson's Steak House) across the street. The Whiskey Bar is located in the Hotel. Overall, the Sutton Place delivers understated elegance, impeccable accommodations, and outstanding service at a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Melissa33
Reviews.Content: The Sutton Place Hotel was simply wonderful! The room was large, spotless, extra comfortable beds, and the view was amazing! The hotel staff was extraordinary. Perfect location for dining and shopping. I couldn't ask for more. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Chicago Location: The Sutton Place”
Reviews.Author: Trip17
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel centrally located in Chicago, with access to great restaurants and attractions. The Sutton Place was perfect. Our room was on the 15th floor with a nice view of the city. The staff was very cordial. I asked the doorman for the name of a place where I could have my shoes shined. He said he would do it himself. When I asked what he would charge me, he said, "Whatever you see fit, sir." The restaurant choices around the hotel are excellent, and a lot of must see places are within a short cab ride. Great place, great price, great night.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again in this fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: keepermom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sutton Place in Chicago for 2 nights. The location of the hotel is excellent within walking distance of the Magnificent Mile and all the shopping you could desire. We walked everywhere for all our shopping and meals. The service was excellent and the room while on the smaller side was very comfortable. The room was very clean and the bed was sumptuous. The best part was the separate bath and shower in the bathroom. We were there during the cold snap and a nice hot bath was perfect after walking around! The parking charge ($42/night) is on the steep side but was comparable to other parking in town and did include in/out privileges. The concierge and doormen were very friendly and offered great recommendations for dinner. If I could get a comparable rate ($150/night) I would definitely stay there again. We walked everywhere. Like another reviewer, I would also recommend the Pancake restaurant across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional choice in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: cooperAtlantaGeorgia
Reviews.Content: My recent business trip to Chicago found me searching for a hotel in the heart of the city. My choice to stay at the Sutton Place Hotel was met with great delight. The accommodations were exceptional and spacious with an upscale and intimate atmosphere. The staff was extremely professional and helpful. The location was fabulous and allowed me to easily get to both business meetings and locally exceptional restaurants. My only regret was that my stay was not longer. This is a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Business_trav36
Reviews.Content: I loved the Sutton Place Hotel in Chicago! The most amazing part of my experience that I will never forget is the bed! It was the most enjoyable nights sleep I had in a long time. The room was cozy, beautiful and so comfortable that I felt like I was at home. Usually its hard for me to sleep in Hotels but not here, I slept so good and felt so rested in the morning!
